subject: Do not apply format expansions to passwords
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 2, 'name': 'Monty Taylor', 'email': 'mordred@inaugust.com', 'username': 'mordred'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 3099, 'name': 'David Shrewsbury', 'email': 'dshrewsb@redhat.com', 'username': 'dshrews'}, {'_account_id': 4978, 'name': 'Julie Pichon', 'email': 'jpichon@redhat.com', 'username': 'jpichon'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 11589, 'name': 'Harry Rybacki', 'email': 'hrybacki@redhat.com', 'username': 'hrybacki'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-12-05 21:00:41.000000000', 'files': ['os_client_config/config.py', 'os_client_config/tests/test_config.py'], 'message': 'Do not apply format expansions to passwords

get_one_cloud() and get_one_cloud_osc() iterate over config
values and try to expand any variables in those values by
calling value.format(), however some config values
(e.g. password) should never have format() applied to them, not
only might that change the password but it will also cause the
format() function to raise an exception if it can not parse the
format string. Examples would be single brace (e.g. 'foo{')
which raises an ValueError because it's looking for a matching
end brace or a brace pair with a key value that cannot be found
(e.g. 'foo{bar}') which raises a KeyError.

It is not reasonsable to try to escape any braces because:

1) Escaping all braces breaks valid use of the format string syntax.

2) Trying to determine exactly which braces should be escaped and
which should be preserved is a daunting task and likely would not be
robust.

3) Some strings might look like valid format syntax but still should
be escaped (e.g. "foo{bar}", if this appeared in a password we
wouldn't escape it and there would be a key error on the 'bar' key.

4) In general passwords should never be modified, you never want to
apply formatting to them.

The right approach is to maintain a list of config values which are
excluded from having formatting applied to them. At the moment that
list just includes 'password' but perhaps down the road other
exceptions might crop up. This patch follows this approach,
the list of excluded values can easily be updated if others are
discovered.

Change-Id: I187bdec582d4c2cc6c7fda47a1538194137c616b
Closes-Bug: 1635696
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Do not apply format expansions to passwords

get_one_cloud() and get_one_cloud_osc() iterate over config
values and try to expand any variables in those values by
calling value.format(), however some config values
(e.g. password) should never have format() applied to them, not
only might that change the password but it will also cause the
format() function to raise an exception if it can not parse the
format string. Examples would be single brace (e.g. 'foo{')
which raises an ValueError because it's looking for a matching
end brace or a brace pair with a key value that cannot be found
(e.g. 'foo{bar}') which raises a KeyError.

It is not reasonsable to try to escape any braces because:

1) Escaping all braces breaks valid use of the format string syntax.

2) Trying to determine exactly which braces should be escaped and
which should be preserved is a daunting task and likely would not be
robust.

3) Some strings might look like valid format syntax but still should
be escaped (e.g. "foo{bar}", if this appeared in a password we
wouldn't escape it and there would be a key error on the 'bar' key.

4) In general passwords should never be modified, you never want to
apply formatting to them.

The right approach is to maintain a list of config values which are
excluded from having formatting applied to them. At the moment that
list just includes 'password' but perhaps down the road other
exceptions might crop up. This patch follows this approach,
the list of excluded values can easily be updated if others are
discovered.

Change-Id: I187bdec582d4c2cc6c7fda47a1538194137c616b
Closes-Bug: 1635696
Signed-off-by: John Dennis <jdennis@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Update containerized undercloud installation doc

Containerized UC becomes a default installation method.
Adjust the documentation to indicate that and note about
instack undercloud deprecation.

Clarify containers registry configuration steps and
undercloud config params for it.

Document the shared bits of the deployment framework
leveraging overcloud and undercloud deployments.

Say a few words for the CLI interface
openstack tripleo deploy --standalone, used underneath
instack-backwards-compatible undercloud installations.

Change-Id: I2352e31857f4044eced87607c8d53841af62df32
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

subject: ignore python2-specific code under python3 for pep8
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 21:03:38.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_common/validation/metrics.py'], 'message': "ignore python2-specific code under python3 for pep8

The type 'long' no longer exists under python 3. The runtime execution
of the code using it in the metrics module already detects the python
version, but when the linter is run under python 3 it does not apply
the same check. Add a noqa pragma to tell the linter to ignore the
line where 'long' is referenced to avoid an error.

Change-Id: If806e6461358ea523708eceed6fdcc3dfb8d75a9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
ignore python2-specific code under python3 for pep8

The type 'long' no longer exists under python 3. The runtime execution
of the code using it in the metrics module already detects the python
version, but when the linter is run under python 3 it does not apply
the same check. Add a noqa pragma to tell the linter to ignore the
line where 'long' is referenced to avoid an error.

Change-Id: If806e6461358ea523708eceed6fdcc3dfb8d75a9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: replace use of 'unicode' builtin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 21:31:09.000000000', 'files': ['monasca_log_api/app/base/model.py'], 'message': "replace use of 'unicode' builtin

The builtin type 'unicode' does not exist under python 3. The runtime
check here is already looking at the python version, but the linter
does not perform the same check and it fails because the name is not
defined. Replace the explicit use of unicode here with six.text_type
so that the linter is happy.

Change-Id: I22a13fddaed1338c0f3e670d199bb6aa5f99bbf7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
replace use of 'unicode' builtin

The builtin type 'unicode' does not exist under python 3. The runtime
check here is already looking at the python version, but the linter
does not perform the same check and it fails because the name is not
defined. Replace the explicit use of unicode here with six.text_type
so that the linter is happy.

Change-Id: I22a13fddaed1338c0f3e670d199bb6aa5f99bbf7
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 19:27:51.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I946210d26cbdcb303b3eca623022608afc141fe3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I946210d26cbdcb303b3eca623022608afc141fe3
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Add tempest coverage for namespace creation

It adds coverage to test namespace creation when the namespace
handler and subnet driver are used. It checks the namespace gets
created but also that the related resources get created too, in this
case the Neutron Subnet, as well as the Kuryr Net CRD. In addition,
it check the KuryrNet CRD has the right information about the network
and subnet IDs created.

Depends-On: I84580201f38c219f1943510bb493da0f07e07153

Change-Id: Iafc08ede300aecf1dc52135c6e51b89875e729d6

commit_message:
Update DB functions to handle contexts

With the new enginefacade [1] all functions that interact with the DB
are expected to recieve a context if they are to do operations inside a
transaction. It is possible to have a mix of session and context aware
functions but it's better to standarize to only context aware functions.
As we migrate into the new enginefacade pattern, this new pattern should
become the norm.

This patch modifies DB functions to handle only context and it is a
preliminary patch to migrate to the new enginefacade pattern.

[1]:
http://specs.openstack.org/openstack/oslo-specs/specs/kilo/make-enginefacade-a-facade.html

Change-Id: I681a02010908373c823d0aecba81c1906da2ec5a

commit_message:
doc: external link helper for other projects' doc

The external link helper makes sure that the generated link
respects the current branch (latest for master, <release_name>
when built on stable/<release_name>.

Do not use it for sahara-tests (which is branchless).

Change-Id: Ie37fe37858a41f54558642ea93a75365668ef573

subject: mock: Temporarely disables the mock autospec fixture
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-03-30 18:55:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/disk/test_ssp.py', 'nova_powervm/tests/virt/powervm/test_driver.py'], 'message': "mock: Temporarely disables the mock autospec fixture

This project's unit tests are based on the nova's test
base, and recently, nova has started using the mock autospec
fixture, which patches the usual mock.Mock and mock.MagicMock
with subclasses that accept the autospec argument and behave
accordingly.

But the autospec mock classes contain an underscore (_AutospecMock,
_AutospecMagicMock), which breaks some unit tests, as some splits by
underscore are being made.

Temporarely disables the mock autospec fixture, until [1] is merged
and released.

[1] I0e0bb5629f63ec18af27b26cb5675ff88f041c00

Change-Id: Id7a863b3e75e42191b76ce282499d80af637899c
Related-Bug: #1735588
"}]
commit_message:
mock: Temporarely disables the mock autospec fixture

This project's unit tests are based on the nova's test
base, and recently, nova has started using the mock autospec
fixture, which patches the usual mock.Mock and mock.MagicMock
with subclasses that accept the autospec argument and behave
accordingly.

But the autospec mock classes contain an underscore (_AutospecMock,
_AutospecMagicMock), which breaks some unit tests, as some splits by
underscore are being made.

Temporarely disables the mock autospec fixture, until [1] is merged
and released.

[1] I0e0bb5629f63ec18af27b26cb5675ff88f041c00

Change-Id: Id7a863b3e75e42191b76ce282499d80af637899c
Related-Bug: #1735588

being done because the archives for the two distros are different. While
the SHA256 sum for the packges is the same today, it stands to reason
that they will differ in the near future.

Change-Id: I9784aa10becbb9dbcfc9222c80a7224201d67741
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Update rabbitmq to the latest stable release

This change updates our version of RabbitMQ server and Erlang to the
latest stable releases. This change adds the distro file for ubuntu
18.04 and 16.04 which replaces the distro family file "debian". This is
being done because the archives for the two distros are different. While
the SHA256 sum for the packges is the same today, it stands to reason
that they will differ in the near future.

Change-Id: I9784aa10becbb9dbcfc9222c80a7224201d67741
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

commit_message:
Add 'osd blacklist' to default mon perms

Ensure that the default permissions for clients include the
'osd blacklist' command;  This ensures that in the event of
a client crashing (due to power outage or segfault), the
client and re-connect and write to any devices on reboot.

This is a safe permission for all supported Ceph releases.

Depends-On: I0b43dece4e1c56fb838b0147bfb75fb9906e6657
Change-Id: Ib1f1e8d7ed54528603b8b08051dafeec075a3232
Closes-Bug: 1773449

commit_message:
Pass container and queue_name inputs to the list_available_roles workflow

The tripleo.plan_management.v1.update_roles workflow didn't pass the plan
name (container name) or Zaqar queue name to the sub-workflow it triggered.
This caused the behaviour to be incorrect when using a name other than the
default. It now correctly passes on these parameters.

Change-Id: Ie0fccbdbfd97005dbc13ae6d1493b8274bb6254e
Closes-Bug: #1775791

commit_message:
Revert "vars: Do not install devel packages by default"

This reverts commit b467764f15f1fb06c9c43813095ebb08d0d28754.

The various os_* roles are missing many build dependencies so dropping
these from the containers results to build failures everywhere. It's
best to do that when all the roles are fixed to contain the build
dependencies they need.

Change-Id: If7e2e732103ed516b9bb73d06c413328c08b93be

commit_message:
Retry namespace deletion to mitigate cascading race

This patch mitigates cascading race by retrying namespace
deletion if the network was not able to be deleted as its
associated ports were not yet deleted.

Partially Implements: blueprint network-namespace

Change-Id: I0518d0e4106665a0e13a8e8b24cfcb0d7744acda

commit_message:
Add ports pool clean up support to namespace deletion

This patch extends the namespace handler to account for existing
ports at kuryr ports pools before deleting the network namespace
resources. It extends the vif_pool driver with support for removing
all the ports of the different pools belonging to the namespace to be
deleted.

Partially Implements: blueprint network-namespace

Change-Id: I84580201f38c219f1943510bb493da0f07e07153

subject: Prevent "server migrate --wait" from hanging
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-05 13:20:41.000000000', 'files': ['openstackclient/compute/v2/server.py'], 'message': 'Prevent "server migrate --wait" from hanging

Migrate uses the same mechanism in the backend than Resize and so the
steps and step names are similar. Currently when using the --wait
option with 'migrate', we wait forever because the status won't get to
active until the user performs an action. This makes it return on
verify_resize status just like 'resize' does, so that the user can
perform the next manual step.

Change-Id: Ie1aeac52506bc8801f88fd6a6eb4f6094cf20050
Story: 2001994
Task: 19620
(cherry picked from commit de9a6fc0700d821f9fca6bf347407eccd87f0064)
'}]
commit_message:
Prevent "server migrate --wait" from hanging

Migrate uses the same mechanism in the backend than Resize and so the
steps and step names are similar. Currently when using the --wait
option with 'migrate', we wait forever because the status won't get to
active until the user performs an action. This makes it return on
verify_resize status just like 'resize' does, so that the user can
perform the next manual step.

Change-Id: Ie1aeac52506bc8801f88fd6a6eb4f6094cf20050
Story: 2001994
Task: 19620
(cherry picked from commit de9a6fc0700d821f9fca6bf347407eccd87f0064)

commit_message:
[generatepot] Removes unnecessary -b option

To generate pot files using Sphinx, just using "-b gettext"
is sufficient and there is no need to additionally specify
such as "-b html" or "-b gettext".

Change-Id: Ibbe420b104a592db39f7f34f496210fcd678eae1

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-06 21:11:10.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I03d26060e9b36ed50062a54b9de29d7dc6787fb9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I03d26060e9b36ed50062a54b9de29d7dc6787fb9
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Prevent updating derived_parameters in plan environment

When deploying overcloud with update-plan-only option, need to
prevent updating the derived parameters section in container
plan-environment file.
derived_parameters will be used only in the deployment
when using overcloud deploy without update-plan-only option.

Change-Id: I35a35910e5f481d7b7fd7cfea6a20ee8e2cc6816
Closes-Bug: #1770109

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-11 09:34:57.000000000', 'files': ['api-ref/source/v2/samples/lbaas/pool-update-response.json', 'api-ref/source/v2/samples/lbaas/listener-create-request.json', 'api-ref/source/v2/samples/lbaas/pool-show-response.json', 'api-ref/source/v2/samples/lbaas/pool-create-response.json', 'api-ref/source/v2/samples/lbaas/pools-list-response.json'], 'message': 'Modify the mistake of lbaas api-ref

and the protocol_port of listener is an integer.
The patch modifies those mistakes.

Change-Id: Iafdc707943724b88f971629374c30d164606b071
'}]
commit_message:
Modify the mistake of lbaas api-ref

The status of pool named "provisioning_status" rather than "status",
and the protocol_port of listener is an integer.
The patch modifies those mistakes.

Change-Id: Iafdc707943724b88f971629374c30d164606b071

commit_message:
Add 'osd blacklist' to default mon perms

Ensure that the default permissions for clients include the
'osd blacklist' command;  This ensures that in the event of
a client crashing (due to power outage or segfault), the
client and re-connect and write to any devices on reboot.

Change-Id: I0b43dece4e1c56fb838b0147bfb75fb9906e6657
Closes-Bug: 1773449

commit_message:
Remove ignore D000 in validation code

This commit going to remove --ignore D000 which had raised
alot of issues, such as:
- "D000 Cannot analyze code. Pygments package not found."
- Cannot check LOG which have '_' symbol in code-base.

And they also fixed in https://review.openstack.org/#/c/568729/

commit_message:
Introduce Cyborg Resource Quota -- Usage Part

The concept of quota gives the possibility to limit the maximum number of
acceleration resources that one project/tenant can prossess.
It will also  give the admin users the ability to increase the resource count
on-demand, given that the system constraints are not exceeded.

Change-Id: I554b9d4603d5e65f69c2b924fba66565f7f6c3c4
Partially-Implements: blueprint cyborg-resource-quota

commit_message:
Write out trusted-host for pypi

With the new pip release, if the host is not https, the host needs
to be trusted. Write out a trusted-host entry for each index if the
URI scheme is not https.

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 20:06:28.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic5b3298c4ea7ebecac333418888335fc286c6489
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic5b3298c4ea7ebecac333418888335fc286c6489
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Enable scenario000 upgrade check job

Add the scenario000 upgrade job on the same files where we run
scenario000 update job. The job is currently non-voting so it's only
added as a check job. This should help us gather some results on real
patches and get some idea of usual run times for this job.

Change-Id: Ia2e011f4e9366377375f4986b4eadd390f4df4ac

Closes-Bug: #1775342

commit_message:
Strip signed certificate

Certificate (ca.crt) has to be striped for some application parsers
as they might require pure base64 representation of
certificate itself, without empty characters
at the beginning nor the end of file

Change-Id: I5f58e19d03abdf040b9a5b5df2f4dd83b4c0e3a9
Closes-Bug: #1775342

revisions:
[{'number': 11, 'created': '2018-06-08 09:35:44.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/cephfs/driver.py', 'releasenotes/notes/config-for-cephfs-volume-prefix-67f2513f603cb614.yaml'], 'message': 'Config for cephfs volume path prefix

The cloud administrator needs to use the cephfs volume path prefix to
layout multiple cephfs driver backends. When cephfs has multiple
data pools, manila can configure `cephfs_volume_path_prefix` to store
volume data in different cephfs directories of a ceph filesystem [1]
for the different cephfs driver backends. Out of band of manila, the
admin can set the pool layouts of these cephfs directories to store
the volume data in different data pools of the ceph filesystem. This
is helpful for planning different data storage to different ceph OSDs.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/d1a21b07ede#diff-8625369b924524f064e083e735bd34beR267

Change-Id: I19e3dd55f1fded339cb17222b3333c0c0f8835e9
Implements: blueprint cephfs-driver-configurable
'}]
commit_message:
Config for cephfs volume path prefix

The cloud administrator needs to use the cephfs volume path prefix to
layout multiple cephfs driver backends. When cephfs has multiple
data pools, manila can configure `cephfs_volume_path_prefix` to store
volume data in different cephfs directories of a ceph filesystem [1]
for the different cephfs driver backends. Out of band of manila, the
admin can set the pool layouts of these cephfs directories to store
the volume data in different data pools of the ceph filesystem. This
is helpful for planning different data storage to different ceph OSDs.

[1] https://github.com/ceph/ceph/commit/d1a21b07ede#diff-8625369b924524f064e083e735bd34beR267

Change-Id: I19e3dd55f1fded339cb17222b3333c0c0f8835e9
Implements: blueprint cephfs-driver-configurable

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 19:27:21.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I69c088c5230e084245076f1176a4c93964f8489f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I69c088c5230e084245076f1176a4c93964f8489f
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-08 14:11:00.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7dfde1d3a1bf58b3913ceadb18aa3bf3c31ac795
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I7dfde1d3a1bf58b3913ceadb18aa3bf3c31ac795

commit_message:
use get reader/writer session from neutron-lib

The get_reader_session and get_writer_session functions are available
in neutron-lib. This patch consumes them by removing the functions
from neutron and using lib's instead in prep for
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/570603

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-08 19:13:44.000000000', 'files': ['ansible/group_vars/all.yml', 'etc/kolla/globals.yml'], 'message': "Fix enabled state for some prometheus services

Some services were enabled by default which, even though they were
never deployed when prometheus wasn't enabled, could cause problems
if the monitoring inventory group was empty.  Changed these services
to be enabled based on whether prometheus is enabled.

Change-Id: I0956a1b65a3577cd57fe3b16a95bc3d64fc142ba
"}]
commit_message:
Fix enabled state for some prometheus services

Some services were enabled by default which, even though they were
never deployed when prometheus wasn't enabled, could cause problems
if the monitoring inventory group was empty.  Changed these services
to be enabled based on whether prometheus is enabled.

Change-Id: I0956a1b65a3577cd57fe3b16a95bc3d64fc142ba

commit_message:
Make method public to support out-of-band cleaning

This makes the _notify_conductor_resume_clean method public by
removing the leading underscore from its name. And move it into
conductor/utils.py.

The idrac hardware type's RAID configuration out-of-band cleaning
has been using it [1].
The method is going to be used by the RAID configuration support
that is being added to the iRMC hardware type [2].

[1] https://github.com/openstack/ironic/blob/580d4338e2bce8e557a5007fcba85e157f0b8d60/ironic/drivers/modules/drac/raid.py#L892
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/512979

Change-Id: Ifd10dd88d65306049119588e6088359a5d38c158

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-06-06 21:14:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/policies/__init__.py', 'nova/api/openstack/compute/virtual_interfaces.py', 'api-ref/source/index.rst', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-virtual-interfaces/vifs-list-resp.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-virtual-interfaces/vifs-list-resp-v2.json.tpl', 'releasenotes/notes/bp-remove-nova-network-api-removals-931ad60364f6f2a8.yaml', 'nova/tests/unit/test_policy.py', 'api-ref/source/os-virtual-interfaces.inc', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/api_samples/os-virtual-interfaces/v2.12/vifs-list-resp.json.tpl', 'nova/tests/unit/fake_policy.py', 'nova/policies/virtual_interfaces.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api_sample_tests/test_virtual_interfaces.py', 'nova/tests/unit/api/openstack/compute/test_virtual_interfaces.py'], 'message': 'Remove support for /os-virtual-interfaces REST API

This drops support for the os-virtual-interfaces compute REST API
which has been deprecated since Newton:

  I1a8a44530be29292561e90d6f7bd7ed512a88ee3

Now it returns 410 response.

Unit tests are removed and the functional API sample test is just
asserting the 410 response now. The API sample docs are left intact
since the API reference still builds from those and can be considered
more or less branchless, so people looking at the API reference can
apply it to older deployments of nova before os-virtual-interfaces was
removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571556/

Part of blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: Id7f94a643e5d7b8a842c0f4a5c9f796d6566b365
'}]
commit_message:
Remove support for /os-virtual-interfaces REST API

This drops support for the os-virtual-interfaces compute REST API
which has been deprecated since Newton:

  I1a8a44530be29292561e90d6f7bd7ed512a88ee3

Now it returns 410 response.

Unit tests are removed and the functional API sample test is just
asserting the 410 response now. The API sample docs are left intact
since the API reference still builds from those and can be considered
more or less branchless, so people looking at the API reference can
apply it to older deployments of nova before os-virtual-interfaces was
removed.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571556/

Part of blueprint remove-nova-network

Change-Id: Id7f94a643e5d7b8a842c0f4a5c9f796d6566b365

commit_message:
Do not explode on empty containers list

In the case the containers list was empty or non existent,
container-check would explode and produce a traceback. This is for
example visible at [1].

This commit makes container-check more robust about the input data.

[1] http://logs.openstack.org/06/572806/1/experimental/tripleo-ci-centos-7-scenario009-multinode-oooq/a88c395/logs/undercloud/home/zuul/overcloud_prep_containers.log.txt.gz

Change-Id: I5639cd2b0b32b8f1261064ee178193f0c589f233

commit_message:
Use preferred option where possible

The --images-file and --env-file options of `openstack overcloud
container image prepare` command were renamed to --output-images-file
and --output-env-file for clarity. Use them wherever possible (pike and
above).

Change-Id: Ie76f08e7a2ac2021ec0b66afa1292bc2eef00b8c

commit_message:
Add IPv6 ND Neighbor Advertiser application

A new extension to the Dragonflow's l2 application.
It enables the controller identify Neighbor Socialitation requests,
and adds a flow that advertise the response.

Partially-implements: blueprint ipv6
Partial-bug: #1480672

Change-Id: I2ea30f5363f7d895cbe4ead5f630713dccc95da4

commit_message:
Delete the 'share_extension:types_extra_specs' policy

The 'share_extension:types_extra_specs' policy were deleted
in mitaka [1]. Now use 'share_types_extra_spec:index' instead
of 'share_extension:types_extra_specs' policy

[1] I334cc0fa8e69c2f9b5226f247149a0b9b748dd60

Closes-bug: #1715522
Change-Id: I334cc0fa8e69c2f9b5226f247149a0b9b748dd31
(cherry picked from commit c485309e2aa1270550f2e039b092e672d7f7bbd9)

commit_message:
Remove volume v1 API service client usage

Volume v1 API has been gone since long and Tempest also
marked their deprecation since Juno
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/446238/

Now Tempest is removing the deprecated config option and
alias for voluem v1 service client in
- https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

Before the Tempest patch gets merged, we need to remove all usage
of volume v1 things.

Change-Id: Ifcf420582644281b792c501c3e438a2c91c335b2
Needed-By: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/573135/

commit_message:
Use OS_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD instead of passing CLI

When bootstrapping use environment variable
OS_BOOTSTRAP_PASSWORD instead of passing password
over CLI since it's a possible leak.

Change-Id: I69783f75600048b9c4b2abb445b59e135029f3df
Partial-Bug: 1557790

commit_message:
Add local-registry image managment to OSH from OSH-Infra

This PS adds the local registry image managment to OSH from OSH-Infra.
With this the delta between helm-toolkits in the Repo's is removed,
allowing the toolkit from OSH-Infra to be used and the one from OSH
to be depreciated.

Change-Id: I09a0aa375ab6e7f38f342ed9c4dcde817b82056c

subject: Gate: disable unbound and setup dns in nodepool VMs
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2018-01-17 06:18:01.000000000', 'files': ['tools/gate/playbooks/upgrade-host/templates/resolv.conf.j2', 'tools/gate/playbooks/upgrade-host/tasks/main.yaml'], 'message': 'Gate: disable unbound and setup dns in nodepool VMs

This ps disables the unbound service and points resolv.conf to the
upstream servers directly when running in nodepool. It is required
to avoid confict with both the kubedns service (which will be used
in place of unbound) and the ingress controllers in OSH.

Change-Id: I92745430d9bb9a411e82bc5fe82e3aa982dc020b
'}]
commit_message:
Gate: disable unbound and setup dns in nodepool VMs

This ps disables the unbound service and points resolv.conf to the
upstream servers directly when running in nodepool. It is required
to avoid confict with both the kubedns service (which will be used
in place of unbound) and the ingress controllers in OSH.

Change-Id: I92745430d9bb9a411e82bc5fe82e3aa982dc020b

commit_message:
Images: Update names to reflect service specific functions

This PS updates the Image variable names to refect service specific
functionality. By doing so it is much easier to track common images
between charts and also provide a simpler interface for testing
different images (eg when changing openstack release, distro or
source - ie. Kolla/LOCI).

Change-Id: I35c7926c0ec54dbc3e3cd8ecd0759e09939edac4

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-09 11:34:15.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/agent/linux/iptables_manager.py'], 'message': '[log] Add default log chains into iptables for logging driver

This patch adds the following log chains into iptables base on discussed
in the patch [1]
- neutron-l3-agent-accepted
- neutron-l3-agent-dropped
- neutron-l3-agent-rejected
These log chains is added to replace ACCEPT, DROP and REJECT action in
logging driver.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509725/

Partial-Bug: #1720727
Change-Id: I727c5485f3e1c03c7f20b3fffcb5b6773255453b
'}]
commit_message:
[log] Add default log chains into iptables for logging driver

This patch adds the following log chains into iptables base on discussed
in the patch [1]
- neutron-l3-agent-accepted
- neutron-l3-agent-dropped
- neutron-l3-agent-rejected
These log chains is added to replace ACCEPT, DROP and REJECT action in
logging driver.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/509725/

Partial-Bug: #1720727
Change-Id: I727c5485f3e1c03c7f20b3fffcb5b6773255453b

subject: Add .stestr.conf configuration
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-05-25 09:20:11.000000000', 'files': ['.gitignore', 'tools/cover.sh', '.testr.conf', 'tox.ini', '.stestr.conf'], 'message': 'Add .stestr.conf configuration

os-testr has moved over to use stestr instead of testr. While this
is usually compaible with existing settings, there is a warning
that is emitted when .stestr.conf is not present. It is usually
able to fall back to parsing the .testr.conf file, but to be more
correct and to prevent future problems we should update the config.

Change-Id: Ic50b076276333c4c1e846f9e2d401f9c62aadf57
'}]
commit_message:
Add .stestr.conf configuration

os-testr has moved over to use stestr instead of testr. While this
is usually compaible with existing settings, there is a warning
that is emitted when .stestr.conf is not present. It is usually
able to fall back to parsing the .testr.conf file, but to be more
correct and to prevent future problems we should update the config.

Change-Id: Ic50b076276333c4c1e846f9e2d401f9c62aadf57

commit_message:
Silence files copying logs

Those logs can be found in the produced jobs' artifacts as well,
no need to list those in the console logs. The lists are huge
and bring no useful info.

Change-Id: I9d832115febf76192de8c5d8f1225eba4217e888
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobreli@redhat.com>

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 19:27:31.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id7c3281bf2ecb9808d7042611a66c957eb8f4c79
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Id7c3281bf2ecb9808d7042611a66c957eb8f4c79
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I80b988b11224df83cdd9ff18aeaf03af6adea293
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-08 10:26:55.000000000', 'files': ['.zuul.yaml', 'tox.ini'], 'message': 'Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I1d990e8c9ab2d979a5e462361cf7a8e3d461138c
'}]
commit_message:
Add python3 django 1.11 job instead of django 2.0 job

Django 2.0 is now used in tox py35 job, so there is no need for
py35dj20 job. Instead, Django 1.11 with python3 is not covered.

- py35dj20 job is dropped from tox.ini.
- python3-django111 is added to tox.ini.
  python3 is specified to basepython to avoid a specific python version.
- .zuul.yaml is updated to consume horizon-openstack-tox-python3-django111
  and drop horizon-openstack-tox-py35dj20.

Change-Id: I1d990e8c9ab2d979a5e462361cf7a8e3d461138c

The safe_reference property in common db mixin is only used by
vmware-nsx and they can use weakref directly (see depends on patch).
This patch removes safe_reference as we're working towards removing
common db mixin all together.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571221/

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C.safe_reference

Change-Id: I77f9561139fd88eff51638f6f41cf79f0b876dc1

commit_message:
remove safe_reference from common db mixin

The safe_reference property in common db mixin is only used by
vmware-nsx and they can use weakref directly (see depends on patch).
This patch removes safe_reference as we're working towards removing
common db mixin all together.

Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/571221/

[1] http://codesearch.openstack.org/?q=%5C.safe_reference

Change-Id: I77f9561139fd88eff51638f6f41cf79f0b876dc1

commit_message:
Updated from generate-constraints

subunit lower-constraint raised because stestr now has a minimum of 1.3.0
networkx kept at 1.11 for breakage
  * https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-requirements/+bug/1718576
eventlet kept at 0.20.0 for breakage
google-auth and google-api-python-client kept at current for cinder breakage
  * https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-requirements/+bug/1775218
Sphinx kep at 1.6.5 for docs breakage
pyldap, removed post1 again
urllib3 is being held back because of requests
  * https://github.com/requests/requests/issues/4673
pexpect is being held back for ansible-runner
  * https://github.com/ansible/ansible-runner/issues/44

Change-Id: I7e4a927db7a20eaa7ee2921868df01c2acf5aa2e

commit_message:
Elasticsearch: Update tests to clean up test data and index

This ps adds a function for cleaning up the test data used to
verify Elasticsearch is functioning properly. It removes the test
index created and populated with test data to ensure the resulting
elasticsearch cluster is clean and does not contain random data

Change-Id: Ibdeb90e3f3b6307bf16c68469556bef256ed2d78

commit_message:
Update "auth_url" in install docs

Based on the change in Keystone Install Guide [1],
this patch replace port 35357 with 5000 for "auth_url" in docs.

For more details, please check similar changes which have been done
on other projects: Nova [2], Neutron [3], Cinder [4], Glance [5].

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/541857
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/562812
[3] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/566491
[4] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/565464
[5] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/558932

Change-Id: I9307a0ac622086f2722b89b78cf0903399942dd1

subject: Cleanup ironic.conf template
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 15:48:45.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/roles/bifrost-ironic-install/templates/ironic.conf.j2'], 'message': 'Cleanup ironic.conf template

This patch removes some deprecated options from ironic config file
template in preparation to their removal from ironic itself:

- remove SSH section, the SSH driver is no longer supported by ironic
- remove [keystone] section altogether, the only option there is
  region_name which is deprecated, use it explicitly in [inspector] and
  [service_catalog] sections when keystone support is enabled
- remove [conductor]api_url option, instead use
  [service_catalog]endpoint_override option
- fix logic in [inspector] section templating, add keystoneauth options
  only when inspector itself is enabled.

Change-Id: Ie4fd92ff2af6b300b0f6ceeaa40538a6c1176e6b
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup ironic.conf template

This patch removes some deprecated options from ironic config file
template in preparation to their removal from ironic itself:

- remove SSH section, the SSH driver is no longer supported by ironic
- remove [keystone] section altogether, the only option there is
  region_name which is deprecated, use it explicitly in [inspector] and
  [service_catalog] sections when keystone support is enabled
- remove [conductor]api_url option, instead use
  [service_catalog]endpoint_override option
- fix logic in [inspector] section templating, add keystoneauth options
  only when inspector itself is enabled.

Change-Id: Ie4fd92ff2af6b300b0f6ceeaa40538a6c1176e6b

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-09 14:46:42.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic56f510130cabac2daa04eb9dbca8edd65e6a803
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ic56f510130cabac2daa04eb9dbca8edd65e6a803

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:

Change-Id: I4e51031d5b0d3f47e185b1370254baafa8eb47a1

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I4e51031d5b0d3f47e185b1370254baafa8eb47a1

commit_message:
Add a new tempest job with a mock datasource

In this tempest job, the mock datasource is used to create an entity
graph with ~20,000 vertices. This job will contain tests for
init procedure, processes, restarts, multiple api calls.

Other data sources are disabled. Heat, Telemetry, Mistral
are not installed.

Depends-On: I9c4c329983bbe5930de5484fa6932b318746ed5c
Depends-On: Ice708f4aaf6132e4e8a7ae6352112f8b563b95b8

subject: changes to graph stop and init
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-06-07 13:10:56.000000000', 'files': ['vitrage/entity_graph/workers.py', 'vitrage/entity_graph/graph_init.py'], 'message': 'changes to graph stop and init

1. Evaluators to receive updates of actions executed during init

During init evaluator workers will not receive evaluator
actions (aka new alarm/states/etc..) as the queues are
read before the processor graph calls subscribe. hence
their graph may not be in sync

2. More robust vitrage-graph stop

Change-Id: Ice708f4aaf6132e4e8a7ae6352112f8b563b95b8
'}]
commit_message:
changes to graph stop and init

1. Evaluators to receive updates of actions executed during init

During init evaluator workers will not receive evaluator
actions (aka new alarm/states/etc..) as the queues are
read before the processor graph calls subscribe. hence
their graph may not be in sync

2. More robust vitrage-graph stop

Change-Id: Ice708f4aaf6132e4e8a7ae6352112f8b563b95b8

commit_message:
WIP: Update coverage job to use stestr

Make it fail this time, set coverage threshold
to 92.

Update the coverage job to use stestr
and bring it in line with other projects
and use '--fail-under 90' to prevent
regressions rather than running the job
twice and comparing results.

Change-Id: I9a5e2ab5da9809a2c7eb69c3d7da195c9151e2a7

Change-Id: I6535479bf2ca915e37b48c673024390baac7dd41

commit_message:
vars: Do not install MySQL-python

We do not need to install the MySQL-python module since nothing really
needs it. The purpose of this role is to simply install the mysql client
on the host. As such we can drop this module and all the devel packages
which are required to build it.

Change-Id: I6535479bf2ca915e37b48c673024390baac7dd41

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 16:46:57.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia8ba790125fb3610d41b19ca682efca9012a5b7b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ia8ba790125fb3610d41b19ca682efca9012a5b7b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Iab2f7ba28ad2a63e0801ba43f3b9c467f7389524

commit_message:
Return all providers - single provider

Getting allocation candidates, in provider_summaries we have only
providers that are in allocation_requests.

This patch fixes it to include all the providers in trees in play
for RequestGroups with ``use_same_provider=True``.

Change-Id: Ibf9699f515910befceac399aa589d59d2598b366
Blueprint: placement-return-all-resources

commit_message:
Add granular policy rules for allocation candidates

This adds the granular policy rule for the
GET /allocation_candidates placement API. By default
it requires role:admin so it's backward compatible
with existing deployments, and requires system scope
tokens.

With this change, we have all of the placement route
handlers covered using per-route policy checks so the
temporary PER_ROUTE_POLICY variable is dropped.

Part of blueprint granular-placement-policy

commit_message:
Gate: fix waiting for nodes following zuul ansible update

For some reason it appears that the task to wait for nodes to come up
requires privilege escalation to work. I suspect this is due to
interation between ansible 2.5.4 and zuuls log streamer, but am not
sure. In the meantime this PS unblocks the gates.

Change-Id: I705f2ddf3facfe56838f606f88cfb15b822d18a5
Signed-off-by: Pete Birley <pete@port.direct>

commit_message:
Bootstrap-Jobs: Use internal endpoint for bootstrapping

This PS moves to use the internal keystone endpoint for boostrapping
jobs, to allow osh to be deployed when the support infrastructure may
not have been fully configured (eg - dns for public endpoints)

[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-06-06 22:19:11.000000000', 'files': ['nova/conf/compute.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_resource_tracker.py', 'nova/conf/scheduler.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_stats.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/weights/test_weights_compute.py', 'nova/tests/unit/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'releasenotes/notes/change-consecutive-boot-failure-counter-to-weigher-428de7da0ed2033a.yaml', 'nova/compute/stats.py', 'nova/test.py', 'nova/tests/unit/scheduler/test_caching_scheduler.py', 'doc/source/admin/configuration/schedulers.rst', 'nova/compute/manager.py', 'nova/scheduler/weights/compute.py', 'nova/tests/functional/test_servers.py', 'nova/compute/resource_tracker.py', 'nova/scheduler/host_manager.py'], 'message': 'Change consecutive build failure limit to a weigher

There is concern over the ability for compute nodes to reasonably
determine which events should count against its consecutive build
failures. Since the compute may erronenously disable itself in
response to mundane or otherwise intentional user-triggered events,
this patch adds a scheduler weigher that considers the build failure
counter and can negatively weigh hosts with recent failures. This
avoids taking computes fully out of rotation, rather treating them as
less likely to be picked for a subsequent scheduling
operation.

This introduces a new conf option to control this weight. The default
is set high to maintain the existing behavior of picking nodes that
are not experiencing high failure rates, and resetting the counter as
soon as a single successful build occurs. This is minimal visible
change from the existing behavior with default configuration.

The rationale behind the default value for this weigher comes from the
values likely to be generated by its peer weighers. The RAM and Disk
weighers will increase the score by number of available megabytes of
memory (range in thousands) and disk (range in millions). The default
value of 1000000 for the build failure weigher will cause competing
nodes with similar amounts of available disk and a small (less than ten)
number of failures to become less desirable than those without, even
with many terabytes of available disk.

Change-Id: I71c56fe770f8c3f66db97fa542fdfdf2b9865fb8
Related-Bug: #1742102
'}]
commit_message:
Change consecutive build failure limit to a weigher

There is concern over the ability for compute nodes to reasonably
determine which events should count against its consecutive build
failures. Since the compute may erronenously disable itself in
response to mundane or otherwise intentional user-triggered events,
this patch adds a scheduler weigher that considers the build failure
counter and can negatively weigh hosts with recent failures. This
avoids taking computes fully out of rotation, rather treating them as
less likely to be picked for a subsequent scheduling
operation.

This introduces a new conf option to control this weight. The default
is set high to maintain the existing behavior of picking nodes that
are not experiencing high failure rates, and resetting the counter as
soon as a single successful build occurs. This is minimal visible
change from the existing behavior with default configuration.

The rationale behind the default value for this weigher comes from the
values likely to be generated by its peer weighers. The RAM and Disk
weighers will increase the score by number of available megabytes of
memory (range in thousands) and disk (range in millions). The default
value of 1000000 for the build failure weigher will cause competing
nodes with similar amounts of available disk and a small (less than ten)
number of failures to become less desirable than those without, even
with many terabytes of available disk.

Change-Id: I71c56fe770f8c3f66db97fa542fdfdf2b9865fb8
Related-Bug: #1742102

subject: Refactor `test_confirm_resize_server` to pass for all roles
revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-06-09 14:43:49.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/compute/test_server_actions_rbac.py'], 'message': 'Refactor `test_confirm_resize_server` to pass for all roles

`test_confirm_resize_server` fails for roles that do not have
permission to perform the confirm resize API. It fails since
the cleanup tries to resize a server that is already in the resized
state [1]. This PS conditionally adds resize to addCleanup based on the
state of the server.

[1] `Details: {u'message': u"Cannot 'resize' instance
cb7c5ddc-959e-4238-9f79-a1963e60228f while it is in vm_state resized",
u'code': 409}`

Change-Id: I1abb13742ed931f15d6ae18ccdc6d790b41a02bf
'}]
commit_message:
Refactor `test_confirm_resize_server` to pass for all roles

`test_confirm_resize_server` fails for roles that do not have
permission to perform the confirm resize API. It fails since
the cleanup tries to resize a server that is already in the resized
state [1]. This PS conditionally adds resize to addCleanup based on the
state of the server.

[1] `Details: {u'message': u"Cannot 'resize' instance
cb7c5ddc-959e-4238-9f79-a1963e60228f while it is in vm_state resized",
u'code': 409}`

Change-Id: I1abb13742ed931f15d6ae18ccdc6d790b41a02bf

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-09 17:12:58.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I816afc3b54935c4e000ed9a2bd09ecc4b283b0f2
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I816afc3b54935c4e000ed9a2bd09ecc4b283b0f2

commit_message:
Sort image list by name when launch instance

Just like the flavor sort issue, this is another regression issue
when we shift from the legacy launch instance wizard. By default,
the image list should be ordered by name.

Change-Id: Id619ad531f7e91326694ee90c112d6a7db0d14ad
(cherry picked from commit 71c488042958648ba51db96d26be630df9bb9ca6)

Optimise: [LVM] Raise explicit error message when reverting

LVM driver supports extending shares and doesn't support
shrinking shares, raise explicit error message when
shrinking shares is required in revert to snapshot
process.

LVM can't extend share when it has snapshot which is mounted

Fix this bug by using command sequence below when
extending share.

1. umount snapshot(s).
2. umount share.
3. deactivate share.
4. extend share.

Closes-Bug: #1663121

commit_message:
Fix: [LVM] Can't extend share when snapshots exist

LVM can't extend share when it has snapshot which is mounted
and activated.
Fix this bug by using command sequence below when
extending share.

1. umount snapshot(s).
2. umount share.
3. deactivate share.
4. extend share.
5. activate share.
6. mount share.
7. mount snapshot(s).

Change-Id: I7ffc0a5b2256a978e58722a0bc9fd699a5d1b5a4
Closes-Bug: #1663121

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-09 10:50:45.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I65ec3ce0c72467486255868bcff79c70b9bf20f8
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I65ec3ce0c72467486255868bcff79c70b9bf20f8

to allow the floating IP.

commit_message:
[WIP]Enable IPv6 in manila(Implement in generic driver)

Please read spec for design detail [1].

The patch list:
    1. Support IPv6 in allow_access [2].
    2. Support IPv6 in network plugins,
       implement IPv6 in lvm, dummy driver [4].
    3. Support IPv6 in generic driver (this)
    4. Support in manilaclient [3].
    5. Scenario tests
    6. Documentation

[1] f7202a6cfe32a057f752a4e393f848f8a0211c36
[2] b8e20971cf74fded7ad49816f8aa8a56da59c874
[3] 1cde7dd972921008f604bdd536dd55862839b3bf
[4] 5df2825f03e4a87c863f3ce2f9e9a4f5049d893e

Change-Id: I92b746be9fce8607674bb3464f29b5369557430f

commit_message:
Invalid ID should return NotFound exception

If manila is not aware of the consistency group snapshot in the URI,
the appropriate response should be HTTPNotFound.
Currently, it is an empty JSON list. Correcting the behavior to return
HTTPNotFound exception.

Change-Id: I54d68da33a00e881e1b75c966192e812b41e2723
Closes-Bug: #1607434

current method gets all access of the specified share,
then filter results in the driver code.
Use both PARENTID and NAME filter of array's API
instead of the old way.

Change-Id: I6a2d70ab853024e073b189be34a0a05596746885
"}]
commit_message:
[TrivialFix] optimize get share access in huawei driver

Array's API supports filtering of share access by name,
current method gets all access of the specified share,
then filter results in the driver code.
Use both PARENTID and NAME filter of array's API
instead of the old way.

Change-Id: I6a2d70ab853024e073b189be34a0a05596746885

commit_message:
Fix uuid format which should without dashed

[1] is wrong amendment which had change the uuid's format from
non-dashed to with dashed. Since [2] had been merged, this patch
fix the format without dashed by oslo.utils.

[1] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/396850/6/manila/test.py
[2] https://review.openstack.org/#/c/398788

Change-Id: I5f1222863b921f36f6fe4daaac80470c324906ba

commit_message:
Fix nfs server service name for rhel.

In rhel, the service name of nfs-server is "nfs-server".
However, in manila, it is hard-coded as nfs-kernel-server.

Change-Id: I9acc924690941e4dc6954aeb49f26ee5f94dbe68
Closes-Bug: #1647915

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2016-11-23 02:54:39.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_security_services.py', 'manila/tests/data/test_helper.py', 'manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/test_share_networks.py'], 'message': 'Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3

Change-Id: I955537ca8049318daae3831f2da477f24ae5888c
'}]
commit_message:
Replace six.iteritems with dict.items()

1.As mentioned in [1], we should avoid using six.iteritems
to achieve iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will
return iterators in PY3 as well. And dict.items/keys will more
readable.
2.In py2, the performance about list should be negligible,
see the link [2].
[1] https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Python3
[2] http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2015-June/066391.html

Change-Id: I955537ca8049318daae3831f2da477f24ae5888c

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-11-17 03:05:03.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/connection.py'], 'message': "Change huawei driver to only pass needed info while replica creating

Sometimes, while creating new replica by huawei driver, the operation
occasionally fails due to the lazy loading exception.

The reason of this exception is because huawei driver passes the entire
share info as a RPC parameter, while RPC call serializes the share info,
there's attribute that can't be proceeded because of DB lazy loading.

This patch fixes this bug by only passing the needed share info to the
RPC call.

Change-Id: I8c522fab23c23c335d20c71ccf3f44d13ed6d852
Closes-Bug: #1642453
"}]
commit_message:
Change huawei driver to only pass needed info while replica creating

Sometimes, while creating new replica by huawei driver, the operation
occasionally fails due to the lazy loading exception.

The reason of this exception is because huawei driver passes the entire
share info as a RPC parameter, while RPC call serializes the share info,
there's attribute that can't be proceeded because of DB lazy loading.

This patch fixes this bug by only passing the needed share info to the
RPC call.

Change-Id: I8c522fab23c23c335d20c71ccf3f44d13ed6d852
Closes-Bug: #1642453

commit_message:
Fix CIFS share access-deny do not take effect in generic driver

When access is denied to a share for a client that had
access, the client is still able to read and write as it
could before access was denied.

Restart the CIFS service so that the access changes take
effect.

Change-Id: I12241e305fb3353cf800a691e1bedb08dd5eecef
Close-Bug: #1641566

commit_message:
huawei driver adds used capacity check before shrinking

Currently, huawei driver doesn't have the check of already used
capacity for thin type share, comparing to the new size expected
to shrink to.

Add this used capacity verification.

Change-Id: I7c19524cfc7b803c250c585d9895de1438e5bc99
Closes-Bug: #1639676

Huawei driver currently uses share id as the entity field of

commit_message:
Change entity value while huawei driver records replication id

Huawei driver currently uses share id as the entity field of
driver_private_data table, however, this'll incur a problem that
cannot create replica for the same share whose original replica
has been deleted, because DB will raise 'duplicated entity'
exception.

This patch fixes this bug.

Change-Id: If5d85a9c6c24c0e7dcbb7b5dd7420f34bc3239d3
Closes-Bug: #1638196

commit_message:
Clear access after promotion for huawei driver

According to huawei driver's implementation, after replica promotion,
the access of original active replica should be cleared, cause huawei
driver only supports 'dr' type.

The access clear request should be sent by RPC, to tell the service
that the original active replica resides on to execute.

This patch implements this logic.

Change-Id: Ib7c24c248a10e88bd406ccd75d3f5acca6c96df4
Closes-Bug: #1637097

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2016-11-02 02:19:35.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/huawei/v3/replication.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/huawei/test_huawei_nas.py'], 'message': 'Resync replication of huawei backend while it's to recover

Currently, once the replication of huawei backend is broken,
the replica state will always be error, even if the replication
connection of huawei backends has recovered.

This's because huawei replication is asynchronous, when the
replication connection is recovered, we need to launch a resync
process manually, then the replication will recover to a
normal status.

Add a resync step in the replica update process, if the replication
status of huawei backend is "to recover".

Change-Id: I2314f56d493610efda226b77b1fe3e171209f0c0
Closes-Bug: #1636401
'}]
commit_message:
Resync replication of huawei backend while it's to recover

Currently, once the replication of huawei backend is broken,
the replica state will always be error, even if the replication
connection of huawei backends has recovered.

This's because huawei replication is asynchronous, when the
replication connection is recovered, we need to launch a resync
process manually, then the replication will recover to a
normal status.

Add a resync step in the replica update process, if the replication
status of huawei backend is "to recover".

Change-Id: I2314f56d493610efda226b77b1fe3e171209f0c0
Closes-Bug: #1636401

commit_message:
Cleanup Newton Release Notes

This adds the earliest-version directive to only show the Newton release
which was 3.0.0.
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/manila/newton.html

Also, do not generate an index file, it is empty, see:
http://docs.openstack.org/releasenotes/manila/genindex.html

Add support for the blockdiag family of diagrams [1]:
blockdiag, actdiag, seqdiag, and nwdiag.

These enable block, sequence, activity and logical network
diagrams, defined in simple text format that
can be easily embedded in our manila docs.  For examples,
see [2].

[1] http://blockdiag.com
[2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/juno-incubator/example.html

'}]
commit_message:
Add support for blockdiag to docs

Add support for the blockdiag family of diagrams [1]:
blockdiag, actdiag, seqdiag, and nwdiag.

These enable block, sequence, activity and logical network
diagrams, defined in simple text format that
can be easily embedded in our manila docs.  For examples,
see [2].

[1] http://blockdiag.com
[2] https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/neutron-specs/specs/juno-incubator/example.html

Change-Id: Ic7782ea0642f7a5912f397376948b45ac134604d

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-02-23 13:30:54.000000000', 'files': ['manila/db/migrations/alembic/versions/44b0a9d124b9_add_missing_index_postgres.py', 'releasenotes/notes/add-index-for-postgres-33784cca59b30b9b.yaml'], 'message': 'Create indexes for foreign keys

Some database backends (for example PostgreSQL) do not automatically
create an index on a ForeignKey. As a results database queries are slow.
Adding the missing indexes and a migration that will only add indexes if

commit_message:
Create indexes for foreign keys

Some database backends (for example PostgreSQL) do not automatically
create an index on a ForeignKey. As a results database queries are slow.
Adding the missing indexes and a migration that will only add indexes if
they were not already there.

Change-Id: If2ccc0d4066afb6095be460fa36068c9bd486cb0
Co-Authored-By: Mate Lakat <mlakat@suse.com>
Closes-bug: #1666547

This patch changed the driver to create file system with user capacity.

Change-Id: I2acf294d45662fd91a153fcd1f76202c3ad10132

commit_message:
[Dell EMC Unity] Create with user capacity

The unity driver is creating the file system with allocated capacity
which caused the usable space is less then the size specified by user.
This patch changed the driver to create file system with user capacity.

Besides, change the version to 3.0.0 for Pike release.

Closes-Bug: 1674882
Change-Id: I2acf294d45662fd91a153fcd1f76202c3ad10132
(cherry picked from commit f07e09cbb8ad65b40a058d07c52d9257100b1315)

We should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators

commit_message:
Replacing six.iteritems() with .items()

We should avoid using six.iteritems to achieve
iterators. We can use dict.items instead, as it will return iterators
in PY3* as well. And dict.items/keys will be more readable.

Change-Id: I98c214d4e3a4363b72a55b73d93111dcfda8f4ed

commit_message:
Add Infortrend Manila Driver

This driver supports NFS and CIFS shares.

The following operations are supported:
 - Create a share.
 - Delete a share.
 - Allow share access.
 - Deny share access.
 - Manage a share.
 - Unmanage a share.
 - Extend a share.
 - Shrink a share.

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint infortrend-manila-driver

Change-Id: Iea6b0c06439f79f2a63605cc44102127cd221235

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-05-26 21:13:53.000000000', 'files': ['contrib/ci/common.sh'], 'message': "CI: Update tempest commit

Manila pins the version of tempest it tests on the gate.
This is antithetical to the tempest plugin mechanism. So,
our gate breaks when some plugin relies on code from tempest
that is not part of the commit manila pins in the CI.

While we are working towards a permanent fix to this problem,
let's update our pin as a workaround.

Closes-Bug: #1693832

Change-Id: Ide131229efdea5a48dc389449602f2b0abb699f7
(cherry picked from commit 76e569a6167c5648864e9cdbf006e274616a8e17)
"}]
commit_message:
CI: Update tempest commit

Manila pins the version of tempest it tests on the gate.
This is antithetical to the tempest plugin mechanism. So,
our gate breaks when some plugin relies on code from tempest
that is not part of the commit manila pins in the CI.

While we are working towards a permanent fix to this problem,
let's update our pin as a workaround.

Closes-Bug: #1693832

Change-Id: Ide131229efdea5a48dc389449602f2b0abb699f7
(cherry picked from commit 76e569a6167c5648864e9cdbf006e274616a8e17)

When create manila share, there will create a manila network

but we not assign a physnet and network_type. There will catch a

commit_message:
Fix: Add provider physnet and network_type to manila

When create manila share, there will create a manila network
with the name 'manila_service_network' which is from manila.conf,
but we not assign a physnet and network_type. There will catch a
error when we have multi provider networks in ml2 (e.g physnet3)
for some reason. So, we need add some options in manila.conf.

Closes-Bug: #1696377
Change-Id: I22c739a8d31098e537c7ed260121dc45da7a4284

[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-06-07 15:11:55.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/ibm-spectrum-scale-compression-support-f7a786191fa1a56c.yaml', 'manila/share/drivers/ibm/gpfs.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/ibm/test_gpfs.py', 'etc/manila/rootwrap.d/share.filters', 'doc/source/devref/share_back_ends_feature_support_mapping.rst'], 'message': 'Add Compression capability support to Spectrum Scale Driver

Spectrum Scale internally uses placement policies to compress
the share. This policy will work only once at time of creation
of share so we are using crontab to compress shares on regular
basis. Triggering the compression policy is configurable.
With this change we are exposing the compression feature of
Spectrum Scale via manila to compress the share.

Implements: blueprint spectrum-scale-compression-support

Change-Id: I79bf9792b787379775b6783043e6f8dbe3c7b4ea
'}]
commit_message:
Add Compression capability support to Spectrum Scale Driver

Spectrum Scale internally uses placement policies to compress
the share. This policy will work only once at time of creation
of share so we are using crontab to compress shares on regular
basis. Triggering the compression policy is configurable.
With this change we are exposing the compression feature of
Spectrum Scale via manila to compress the share.

Implements: blueprint spectrum-scale-compression-support

commit_message:
Use constants for microversion values

We very often end up with merge conflicts for any patches that increment
microversions due to conflicting numbers. We can't really solve that,
but we can avoid the need to update version numbers throughout the code
by defining a constant value in one place and using that variable
instead.

Based on cinder change [1].

[1] Ib3a80fee6caaabb49af097aa197f550c65d94985

Change-Id: I375e319a887812ce1390630d2ba8f58e18c41c77

commit_message:
Replace assertDictMatch with assertDictEqual
assertDictMatch was introduced for Python 2.6 only.
Python 2.7+ contains assertDictEqual.
Closes-Bug: #1646433

Change-Id: Id9593496cc4a29f65cde83084910bcb29cbd5e01

commit_message:
Huawei driver refactor

Huawei driver code currently has many redundant logic and has much
potentiality to improve.
This patch does some refactor, to make the Huawei driver code much
more clear, reliable and maintainable.

Change-Id: I7de4ffb8f84a6003af7caf911d44aa62be401935
TODO: UT refactor work is under way.

commit_message:
Remove v2 nova/neutron/cinder client options

Keystone v2 options for the nova, neutron, and cinder clients
used by manila were deprecated in mitaka [1] for removal in
a later release.

Remove these for Queens.

[1] Ic211a11308a3295409467efd88bff413482ee58d

Implements BP remove-v2-client-options

Change-Id: Ifece3c204533977f296a85f92735e189dd4c860c

subject: Switch lxc-dnsmasq to start before lxc
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-09 11:58:36.000000000', 'files': ['templates/lxc-dnsmasq-systemd-init.j2'], 'message': 'Switch lxc-dnsmasq to start before lxc

The current state of lxc-dnsmasq starts it after the network
subsystem is started (but not necessarily up) and it could
possibly start after lxc.  This changes things to reflect how
lxc-net upstream systemd file sets up dependencies[1].

[1]: https://github.com/lxc/lxc/blob/master/config/init/systemd/lxc-net.service.in

Change-Id: If378446333dd09e378b3acd297c58fd59ce04789
(cherry picked from commit c5a8965557da2f6d949b8bda28eca0785a7d2c3a)
'}]
commit_message:
Switch lxc-dnsmasq to start before lxc

The current state of lxc-dnsmasq starts it after the network
subsystem is started (but not necessarily up) and it could
possibly start after lxc.  This changes things to reflect how
lxc-net upstream systemd file sets up dependencies[1].

[1]: https://github.com/lxc/lxc/blob/master/config/init/systemd/lxc-net.service.in

Change-Id: If378446333dd09e378b3acd297c58fd59ce04789
(cherry picked from commit c5a8965557da2f6d949b8bda28eca0785a7d2c3a)

commit_message:
Remove deprecated ip floating commands

We had already implemented floating ip(pool) commands more
than two cycles, we can remove those deprecated commands.

Change-Id: Ib98a7403a63bb0c48c03de4c79795737de2aa84c

subject: Update the version of erlang to support rabbitmq
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-07 14:50:55.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/elang-version-2c1135466ef94032.yaml', 'tasks/install_yum.yml', 'vars/redhat.yml', 'vars/debian.yml', 'tasks/install_apt.yml', 'tests/rabbitmq_server-upgrade-overrides.yml', 'tox.ini', 'defaults/main.yml', 'meta/main.yml'], 'message': 'Update the version of erlang to support rabbitmq

The version of erlang we're using, while functional, is not recommended.
This change updates our version of erlang for rabbitmq to be the
recommended version by changing the pinned version of erlang.

The apt package pinning meta dependency has been removed and put into
the apt task file as an include role. To ensure a more uniform process
for setting the version of erlang used with rabbitmq the new variable
`rabbitmq_erlang_version_spec` has been added. This option has a default
of "null" and is set by distro specific variables when applicable.

Erlang version support matrix: https://www.rabbitmq.com/which-erlang.html

Change-Id: Iced12d4533eec068bd11d8bd235d81308ef40427
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
(cherry picked from commit 372ccd1bbdbe63ad35a200afab55bb91c4c016da)
'}]
commit_message:
Update the version of erlang to support rabbitmq

The version of erlang we're using, while functional, is not recommended.
This change updates our version of erlang for rabbitmq to be the
recommended version by changing the pinned version of erlang.

The apt package pinning meta dependency has been removed and put into
the apt task file as an include role. To ensure a more uniform process
for setting the version of erlang used with rabbitmq the new variable
`rabbitmq_erlang_version_spec` has been added. This option has a default
of "null" and is set by distro specific variables when applicable.

Erlang version support matrix: https://www.rabbitmq.com/which-erlang.html

Change-Id: Iced12d4533eec068bd11d8bd235d81308ef40427
