subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-09 17:10:26.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If16e79070324776e14279ec0ab12cbebb6a04a5b
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If16e79070324776e14279ec0ab12cbebb6a04a5b

commit_message:
Switch lxc-dnsmasq to start before lxc

The current state of lxc-dnsmasq starts it after the network
subsystem is started (but not necessarily up) and it could
possibly start after lxc.  This changes things to reflect how
lxc-net upstream systemd file sets up dependencies[1].

[1]: https://github.com/lxc/lxc/blob/master/config/init/systemd/lxc-net.service.in

Change-Id: If378446333dd09e378b3acd297c58fd59ce04789
(cherry picked from commit c5a8965557da2f6d949b8bda28eca0785a7d2c3a)

subject: Fix etcd advertise and listen client URLs
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 5638, 'name': 'Davanum Srinivas', 'email': 'davanum@gmail.com', 'username': 'dims-v'}, {'_account_id': 10118, 'name': 'IBM PowerKVM CI', 'email': 'kvmpower@linux.vnet.ibm.com', 'username': 'powerkvm', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10385, 'name': 'Citrix XenServer CI', 'username': 'citrix_xenserver_ci', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11536, 'name': 'hongbin', 'email': 'hongbin034@gmail.com', 'username': 'hongbin'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2017-10-11 03:05:43.000000000', 'files': ['lib/etcd3'], 'message': 'Fix etcd advertise and listen client URLs

Theses URLs are currently set to SERVICE_HOST, which makes etcd
unable to start in subnode. In order to fix it, this patch changes
the following URLs:
* advertise-client-urls: List of this member's client URLs to
  advertise to the rest of the cluster. These URLs can contain domain
  names [1]. Example: "http://example.com:2379, http://10.0.0.1:2379"
* listen-client-urls: List of URLs to listen on for client traffic.
  This flag tells the etcd to accept incoming requests from the clients
  on the specified scheme://IP:port combinations. Scheme can be either
  http or https. If 0.0.0.0 is specified as the IP, etcd listens to
  the given port on all interfaces. If an IP address is given as well
  as a port, etcd will listen on the given port and interface. Multiple
  URLs may be used to specify a number of addresses and ports to
  listen on. The etcd will respond to requests from any of the listed
  addresses and ports [2].

In before, these two URLs were set by using SERVICE_HOST, which
seems incorrect, because SERVICE_HOST is not necessary the IP address
of current host. However, etcd have to advertise or listen to
an IP address/domain of current host. Use HOST_IP for these URLs
should be a more reasonable choice.

[1] https://coreos.com/etcd/docs/latest/v2/configuration.html
    #advertise-client-urls
[2] https://coreos.com/etcd/docs/latest/v2/configuration.html
    #listen-client-urls

Change-Id: I27b29349d8d55c588f88461ac3658fd1b1342a1f
Closes-Bug: #1720240
'}]
commit_message:
Fix etcd advertise and listen client URLs

Theses URLs are currently set to SERVICE_HOST, which makes etcd
unable to start in subnode. In order to fix it, this patch changes
the following URLs:
* advertise-client-urls: List of this member's client URLs to
  advertise to the rest of the cluster. These URLs can contain domain
  names [1]. Example: "http://example.com:2379, http://10.0.0.1:2379"
* listen-client-urls: List of URLs to listen on for client traffic.
  This flag tells the etcd to accept incoming requests from the clients
  on the specified scheme://IP:port combinations. Scheme can be either
  http or https. If 0.0.0.0 is specified as the IP, etcd listens to
  the given port on all interfaces. If an IP address is given as well
  as a port, etcd will listen on the given port and interface. Multiple
  URLs may be used to specify a number of addresses and ports to
  listen on. The etcd will respond to requests from any of the listed
  addresses and ports [2].

In before, these two URLs were set by using SERVICE_HOST, which
seems incorrect, because SERVICE_HOST is not necessary the IP address
of current host. However, etcd have to advertise or listen to
an IP address/domain of current host. Use HOST_IP for these URLs
should be a more reasonable choice.

[1] https://coreos.com/etcd/docs/latest/v2/configuration.html
    #advertise-client-urls
[2] https://coreos.com/etcd/docs/latest/v2/configuration.html
    #listen-client-urls

Change-Id: I27b29349d8d55c588f88461ac3658fd1b1342a1f
Closes-Bug: #1720240

Don't install and start etcd3 in subnode

If subnodes wants to use etcd service, they should access the etcd
installed in SERVICE_HOST.

subject: Fix update/upgrade or config change for ODL
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 8042, 'name': 'Jiří Stránský', 'email': 'jistr@redhat.com', 'username': 'jistr'}, {'_account_id': 10873, 'name': 'Juan Antonio Osorio Robles', 'email': 'jaosorior@redhat.com', 'username': 'ejuaoso'}, {'_account_id': 12398, 'name': 'Dan Sneddon', 'email': 'dsneddon@redhat.com', 'username': 'dsneddon'}, {'_account_id': 14985, 'name': 'Alex Schultz', 'email': 'aschultz@next-development.com', 'username': 'mwhahaha'}, {'_account_id': 17280, 'name': 'Tim Rozet', 'email': 'trozet@redhat.com', 'username': 'trozet'}, {'_account_id': 18851, 'name': 'Marius Cornea', 'email': 'mcornea@redhat.com', 'username': 'mcornea'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 23181, 'name': 'RDO Third Party CI', 'email': 'dmsimard+rdothirdparty@redhat.com', 'username': 'rdothirdparty', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-08 19:13:39.000000000', 'files': ['docker/services/opendaylight-api.yaml', 'releasenotes/notes/fix-odl-update-upgrade-cache-83004abe108971c1.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix update/upgrade or config change for ODL

OpenDaylight creates multiple files the first time it boots, which we do
not mount to the host. After the first boot, it creates a cache which we
do mount to the host. This means that on a config change or
update/upgrade of ODL the cache will not be removed, but the files will
be. This causes ODL to fail to start.

The solution is to stop the container in update/upgrade and then remove
the cache before the update happens. This will trigger the new ODL to
rebuild the cache with the new ODL version.  For config change, we also
need to remove the cache in the host_prep_tasks so that we do not end up
in a similar state.

Closes-Bug: 1775919

Change-Id: Ia457b90b765617822e9adbf07485c9ea1fe179e5
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix update/upgrade or config change for ODL

OpenDaylight creates multiple files the first time it boots, which we do
not mount to the host. After the first boot, it creates a cache which we
do mount to the host. This means that on a config change or
update/upgrade of ODL the cache will not be removed, but the files will
be. This causes ODL to fail to start.

The solution is to stop the container in update/upgrade and then remove
the cache before the update happens. This will trigger the new ODL to
rebuild the cache with the new ODL version.  For config change, we also
need to remove the cache in the host_prep_tasks so that we do not end up
in a similar state.

Closes-Bug: 1775919

Change-Id: Ia457b90b765617822e9adbf07485c9ea1fe179e5
Signed-off-by: Tim Rozet <trozet@redhat.com>

commit_message:
vars: Do not install devel packages by default

There is no good reason why we need to install devel packages in the
containers or the host. If devel packages are required to build pip
packages then the individual roles should pull them in instead. Dropping
these packages makes the containers slightly smaller and also drops the
time it takes to bootstrap them.

Change-Id: I813b4800dd3ce22f5f5d7d7cd0ac4fce5661b1e3

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We can't set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36 due to https://github.com/tox-dev/tox/issues/425

Change-Id: I27cdedcdd7d499da545444174efb06a0f5b3948e

commit_message:
Restoring Encrypted Backup with encrypt-file.

expanded. All 3 modules are explained together, explaining
that the rbac_authority module contains an abstract

Change-Id: I33bbe2da67683faafd0749b687b99237ac815009

commit_message:
Docs: Add requirements authority module to documentation

This patchset includes documentation on the rbac_authority
and the requirements_authority modules. In addition,
the documentation for the policy_authority module is
expanded. All 3 modules are explained together, explaining
that the rbac_authority module contains an abstract
class consumed by the classes in the other two modules.

The use cases for each validation approach is also included
in the documentation.

Finally, some documentation syntax issues are corrected.

Change-Id: I33bbe2da67683faafd0749b687b99237ac815009

commit_message:
Fix response code on snapshot manage/unmanage APIs

Snapshot manage/unmanage APIs are using the HTTPUnprocessableEntity
exception (error 422), but according to the guidelines, this should not
be used. This patch changes them to HTTPBadRequest.

APIImpact
Closes-bug: #1606670
Change-Id: I124a569938d1ca06ce5234c7d0bf26ffbad60e73

commit_message:
[Tempest] Run tempest with the only plugin - manila's

Manila CI jobs have been broken several times by incompatibility with
Tempest plugins of other projects.
So, to avoid it in future, run Manila tests from Tempest's venv where
sitepackages are disabled.

Change-Id: If3d466ee0877a1bc8cdecff616a3061c40977169

commit_message:
PoC Data Service API

This patch adds a Data Service API that allows users to perform data
operations on shares such as data copy from a share to another
share and erase data from a share.

TODO:
- Unit tests
- Tempest tests
- Reno

Implements: blueprint data-service-api
Change-Id: I1014520abef2572fe10cf1534349bcc00ed4b2a0

commit_message:
Fix logging error on ensure_share

ensure_share is not a required feature for manila drivers, but when a
NotImplementedError exception is thrown by the driver, it is currently
being logged as an error. This patch fixes that by skipping this log
if the exception is a NotImplementedError.

Change-Id: I754071ccf4084095bfeec2e4c60cb984ae2f6d4a
Closes-bug: #1594461

commit_message:
Implement extend and shrink features for glusterfs

* create _resize_share() function to change volume quota
* create _get_df_data() function to get volume quota
* implement extend_share() function on _resize_share() function
* implement shrink_share() function on _resize_share() function

Change-Id: I3f69c4ac66900409ec8bf20ea207f782c1b73a29
Implements: blueprint resize-glusterfs-share

commit_message:
Driver Data Service Helper

This change is a Proof of Concept that adds a helper class to allow
drivers to submit data copy and data deletion requests to the Data
Service.

This change is laying ground so driver maintainers can implement
their new features on top of this and provide feedback on necessary
changes.

To use the helper, drivers need to get it from kwargs.

This change depends on Id32f0f0103e2ec69968e3282747a609bb50b8ebf.

DocImpact

Implements: blueprint driver-data-service-helper
Change-Id: I487216ed473ddcd7c4df0505e18b850c196f36f9

commit_message:
Base Data Copy changes

This change introduces compatibility to both Driver Data Service
Helper and Data Service API. Both features rely on the same
common code, thus it is included in this change.

This change is also dependent on the latest Share Migration code.

Partially implements: blueprint driver-data-service-helper
Change-Id: Id32f0f0103e2ec69968e3282747a609bb50b8ebf

commit_message:
Fix issue with old opts in neutron client

Some options like api_insecure will be just ignored.
For this case kauth1 does have a special deprecated_opts
parameter which can be used. Client nova and cinder do
already map the opts manually.

Change-Id: Ie9e61786df1341dc98527c0b1498e508e64102bf
Closes-bug: #1591877

commit_message:
Do not allow to active two clean-up methods simultaneously

Activating periodic share clean-up (automatic_share_server_cleanup) and
delete_share_server_with_last_share causes race conditions.

Change-Id: I35d20d016ac9617b32ea136d0dd59d00901cb259
Closes-bug: #1587835

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 7102, 'name': 'Thomas Bechtold', 'email': 'thomas.bechtold@canonical.com', 'username': 'toabctl'}, {'_account_id': 7872, 'name': 'Marc Koderer', 'email': 'marc@koderer.com', 'username': 'mkoderer'}, {'_account_id': 15942, 'name': 'Dell EMC Isilon CI', 'email': 'emc.isilon.ci@emc.com', 'username': 'e', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 16643, 'name': 'Goutham Pacha Ravi', 'email': 'gouthampravi@gmail.com', 'username': 'gouthamr'}, {'_account_id': 18752, 'name': 'Tegile Storage CI', 'email': 'openstack.ci@tegile.com', 'username': 'tegile', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2016-05-24 12:27:55.000000000', 'files': ['manila_tempest_tests/tests/api/base.py', 'manila/tests/api/v1/test_share_networks.py', 'manila/api/v1/share_networks.py'], 'message': '[WiP] Check share-network uuids in api call

A very common mistake in manila is adding a wrong uuid in the
share-network-create command. The current outcome is that
manila accepts the creation of the share-network but the share creation
fails with an error message on the server side.

When the user specifies a "neutron-net-id" (or subnet or nova-net) the
input should be validated.

Closes-bug: #1583048

Change-Id: I403fcafa0c31b3f27c760c221c471485999d4a4e
'}]
commit_message:
[WiP] Check share-network uuids in api call

A very common mistake in manila is adding a wrong uuid in the
share-network-create command. The current outcome is that
manila accepts the creation of the share-network but the share creation
fails with an error message on the server side.

When the user specifies a "neutron-net-id" (or subnet or nova-net) the
input should be validated.

Closes-bug: #1583048

Change-Id: I403fcafa0c31b3f27c760c221c471485999d4a4e

commit_message:
[Tempest] Try delete resources in cleanup only once

Currently each tempest test of single class has in its own
cleanup queue resources of other tests. If some resource fails
to be deleted then all cleanups of subsequent tests fail too.

Therefore, rewrite cleanup logic in base test class to start using
'addCleanup' bound method for single-test-related resources.
It will make all resources be cleaned up only once.

Change-Id: Ibb44827c87eb6944defa15eb4bcb0e5544f76e7e
Closes-Bug: #1569544

Since the sshd service is managed by puppet on the host during step 1,

commit_message:
Temporarily disable Ansible SSH ControlMaster during step 1

Since the sshd service is managed by puppet on the host during step 1,
the service will often need to be restarted. When it's restarted, this
can cause connection hangs and interruptions from the ansible control
node side. Temporarily disabling ControlMaster during the host
configuration of step 1 to workaround this issue.

Change-Id: I73b4bc2389099eb8881c100be9b9ec97180676d0
Partial-Bug: #1773837

subject: Fix SSL support
revisions:
[{'number': 10, 'created': '2018-06-07 14:01:34.000000000', 'files': ['tasks/galera_setup.yml', 'tasks/galera_ssl_self_signed.yml', 'templates/debian.cnf.j2', 'zuul.d/project.yaml', 'templates/my.cnf.j2', 'tox.ini', 'zuul.d/jobs.yaml'], 'message': 'Fix SSL support

The problems at the moment with setting up SSL support with
Galera are:

- The keys are not used when creating users in the mysql_user
  Ansible module
- The private key must be converted to PKCS-1 in order to work
  properly with Galera.
- The MySQL client configuration is missing the settings that
  include the SSL certificates.
- Hard-coding the cipher causes problems for older clients,
  so we instead enable SSL and let the client and server
  negociate the ideal cipher.

This patch cleans up all of those issues, removes verbose
logging from the SSL job because we have ARA to gather all
the information we need and adds jobs for all the deployment
platforms that we support.

Change-Id: I27218c4086a50d238082895092fb8aa5e7fad807
'}]
commit_message:
Fix SSL support

The problems at the moment with setting up SSL support with
Galera are:

- The keys are not used when creating users in the mysql_user
  Ansible module
- The private key must be converted to PKCS-1 in order to work
  properly with Galera.
- The MySQL client configuration is missing the settings that
  include the SSL certificates.
- Hard-coding the cipher causes problems for older clients,
  so we instead enable SSL and let the client and server
  negociate the ideal cipher.

This patch cleans up all of those issues, removes verbose
logging from the SSL job because we have ARA to gather all
the information we need and adds jobs for all the deployment
platforms that we support.

Change-Id: I27218c4086a50d238082895092fb8aa5e7fad807

commit_message:
Update tunnel_types config option help msg

OVS agent supports gre, vxlan and geneve tunnels.
Geneve was missing in tunnel_types help description.
This patch adds it there.

TrivialFix

[{'number': 13, 'created': '2016-08-01 13:02:51.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/layout_heketi.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/glusterfs/test_layout_heketi.py', 'manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/__init__.py', 'manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/glusterfs_native.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/glusterfs/test_certdeploy.py', 'manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/layout.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/glusterfs/test_glusterfs_native.py', 'manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/certdeploy.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/glusterfs/test_layout.py', 'manila/opts.py'], 'message': 'glusterfs-native: use Heketi layout via self-signing

The certificate setup that needed by the GlusterFS
native driver is not managed by Heketi. So the
GlusterFS setup provided by pure Heketi is
insatisfactory for GlusterFS native.

Howver, if the driver takes up the role of the
certificate authority (CA) and it generates, signs and
deploys certificates for the nodes involved in the
Heketi configuration, the requirements can be met.

Change-Id: I7d0306c2c6ecd7823e49c1ba58819ce28f2eb100

commit_message:
glusterfs-native: use Heketi layout via self-signing

The certificate setup that needed by the GlusterFS
native driver is not managed by Heketi. So the
GlusterFS setup provided by pure Heketi is
insatisfactory for GlusterFS native.

Howver, if the driver takes up the role of the
certificate authority (CA) and it generates, signs and
deploys certificates for the nodes involved in the
Heketi configuration, the requirements can be met.

Partially implements bp smart-glusterfs-management-with-heketi

Change-Id: I7d0306c2c6ecd7823e49c1ba58819ce28f2eb100

commit_message:
glusterfs: heketi: Add support for JWT Auth

Heketi features a JWT (RFC 7519) based authorization mechanism.
This patch allows us to use Heketi setups where this feature
is enabled (which would be the case with real life setups).

Partially implements bp smart-glusterfs-management-with-heketi

Change-Id: I6e115ea24bfedc13ca72aae545618b4ceb027920

revisions:
[{'number': 18, 'created': '2016-08-01 13:02:51.000000000', 'files': ['manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/layout_heketi.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/glusterfs/test_layout_heketi.py', 'manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/__init__.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/glusterfs/test_common.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/glusterfs/test_heketiclient.py', 'manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/heketiclient.py', 'manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/common.py', 'manila/share/drivers/glusterfs/layout.py', 'manila/tests/share/drivers/glusterfs/test_layout.py', 'manila/opts.py'], 'message': "glusterfs: introducing Heketi layout

Heketi (http://github.com/heketi/heketi) is a high level
GlusterFS management service that offers a REST API which
allows a much smoother integration of GlusterFS as a cloud
component than direct GlusterFS interaction.

This commit is adding new a glusterfs layout that utilizes
Heketi. The mapping of entities between Manila and GlusterFS
is the same as with the volume layout, ie. a Manila share
shall be backed by a whole GlusterFS volume. However,
instead of relying on a pre-prepared volume pool as with
volume layout, Heketi lets us to create volumes on an
on-demand base. Also, the code can be much simpler, as a
Heketi setup can guarantee us a certain uniformity of the
GlusterFS deployment it manages (so for example, we don't
have to engage with a trial-and-error based guesswork to
find out whether the setup or the volume in question
supports snapshots, rather we can ask Heketi to create us a
volume that supports snapshots).

This commit enables Heketi layout for the glusterfs driver.
For glusterfs-native, some further driver/layout hooks are
needed to be able to work with Heketi, which will be
provided by a subsequent commit.

Partially implements bp smart-glusterfs-management-with-heketi

Change-Id: I1381bbfc3bea19f3dc72429a566c49b9d7e40a10
"}]
commit_message:
glusterfs: introducing Heketi layout

Heketi (http://github.com/heketi/heketi) is a high level
GlusterFS management service that offers a REST API which
allows a much smoother integration of GlusterFS as a cloud
component than direct GlusterFS interaction.

This commit is adding new a glusterfs layout that utilizes
Heketi. The mapping of entities between Manila and GlusterFS
is the same as with the volume layout, ie. a Manila share
shall be backed by a whole GlusterFS volume. However,
instead of relying on a pre-prepared volume pool as with
volume layout, Heketi lets us to create volumes on an
on-demand base. Also, the code can be much simpler, as a
Heketi setup can guarantee us a certain uniformity of the
GlusterFS deployment it manages (so for example, we don't
have to engage with a trial-and-error based guesswork to
find out whether the setup or the volume in question
supports snapshots, rather we can ask Heketi to create us a
volume that supports snapshots).

This commit enables Heketi layout for the glusterfs driver.
For glusterfs-native, some further driver/layout hooks are
needed to be able to work with Heketi, which will be
provided by a subsequent commit.

Partially implements bp smart-glusterfs-management-with-heketi

Change-Id: I1381bbfc3bea19f3dc72429a566c49b9d7e40a10

When a network is removed from a dhcp agent, in some scenarios if the

commit_message:
Fix unscheduling fail when concurrent port delete

When a network is removed from a dhcp agent, in some scenarios if the
agent releases its port concurrently, there is chance that the
unscheduling will fail due to that the target port is not found.

Catch the PortNotFound exception as an expected error under this type of
concurrent circumstance and logs it to move forward.

Closes-Bug: #1775496
Change-Id: Ib51b364f6ced0de7685c8ee07c1d292308d919f5
Signed-off-by: Kailun Qin <kailun.qin@intel.com>

commit_message:
Switch lxc-dnsmasq to start before lxc

The current state of lxc-dnsmasq starts it after the network
subsystem is started (but not necessarily up) and it could
possibly start after lxc.  This changes things to reflect how
lxc-net upstream systemd file sets up dependencies[1].

[1]: https://github.com/lxc/lxc/blob/master/config/init/systemd/lxc-net.service.in

Change-Id: If378446333dd09e378b3acd297c58fd59ce04789

subject: Fix error in 'used' quota when creating share
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6413, 'name': 'Victoria Martinez de la Cruz', 'email': 'victoria@redhat.com', 'username': 'vkmc'}, {'_account_id': 8064, 'name': 'Jake Yip', 'email': 'jake.yip@ardc.edu.au', 'username': 'jake'}, {'_account_id': 9003, 'name': 'Tom Barron', 'email': 'tpb@dyncloud.net', 'username': 'tbarron'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2017-10-30 00:08:42.000000000', 'files': ['manila_ui/dashboards/project/shares/__init__.py'], 'message': "Fix error in 'used' quota when creating share

The 'Create Share' button calls tenant_quota_usages() to find out if a
user has sufficient quota, disabling the button if there is insufficient
quota. However, the call tenant_quota_usages() is not indempotent,
resulting in usages showing the wrong value.

This is because usages.tally() increments 'used' by value passed to it,
instead of setting it to the value. To work around this, we set 'used'
to zero before calling tally() so that this function is idempotent.

Change-Id: I3193adc95cebb29f13afa6ebd848985495d60d83
"}]
commit_message:
Fix error in 'used' quota when creating share

The 'Create Share' button calls tenant_quota_usages() to find out if a
user has sufficient quota, disabling the button if there is insufficient
quota. However, the call tenant_quota_usages() is not indempotent,
resulting in usages showing the wrong value.

This is because usages.tally() increments 'used' by value passed to it,
instead of setting it to the value. To work around this, we set 'used'
to zero before calling tally() so that this function is idempotent.

Change-Id: I3193adc95cebb29f13afa6ebd848985495d60d83

subject: Move database creation into role (keystone)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 16:28:27.000000000', 'files': ['test-vars.yml', 'test-install-keystone.yml'], 'message': 'Move database creation into role (keystone)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the test-vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I2d313410fa79184f77e6f8331e27cacc498878ba
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571774
'}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role (keystone)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the test-vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: I2d313410fa79184f77e6f8331e27cacc498878ba
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571774

commit_message:
Replace 'Extend Share' by 'Resize Share'

While shares can be extended and shrunk from the command line interface,
the UI only offers 'Extend Share'. Rather than adding 'Shrink Share' in
addition, this patch proposes to replace 'Extend Share' by 'Resize Share'
for a better user experience. The new option allows to increase as well
as decrease the size of a share from the same panel.

Change-Id: Iaada1d81c394ad4dd3b26a4df0eb8a4f70762b6b
Closes-Bug: #1642627

commit_message:
Add granular policy rules for traits in placement

This adds the granular policy rule defaults for
traits-related APIs in the placement service. By
default these are backward-compatible and require
the admin role. They also specify the system scope
type since traits are defined and used by the system,
but scope enforcement is disabled by default in
oslo.policy.

Part of blueprint granular-placement-policy

Change-Id: I9a8af3cae34e32438df12125b9bf32ccdde3b792

subject: Update the version of erlang to support rabbitmq
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2018-06-07 14:58:48.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/elang-version-2c1135466ef94032.yaml', 'tasks/install_yum.yml', 'vars/redhat.yml', 'vars/debian.yml', 'tasks/install_apt.yml', 'tests/rabbitmq_server-upgrade-overrides.yml', 'tox.ini', 'defaults/main.yml', 'meta/main.yml'], 'message': 'Update the version of erlang to support rabbitmq

The version of erlang we're using, while functional, is not recommended.
This change updates our version of erlang for rabbitmq to be the
recommended version by changing the pinned version of erlang.

The apt package pinning meta dependency has been removed and put into
the apt task file as an include role. To ensure a more uniform process
for setting the version of erlang used with rabbitmq the new variable
`rabbitmq_erlang_version_spec` has been added. This option has a default
of "null" and is set by distro specific variables when applicable.

Erlang version support matrix: https://www.rabbitmq.com/which-erlang.html

Change-Id: Iced12d4533eec068bd11d8bd235d81308ef40427
(cherry picked from commit ce90c91857de4a840e5db655a3a42b5de0482ede)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Update the version of erlang to support rabbitmq

The version of erlang we're using, while functional, is not recommended.
This change updates our version of erlang for rabbitmq to be the
recommended version by changing the pinned version of erlang.

The apt package pinning meta dependency has been removed and put into
the apt task file as an include role. To ensure a more uniform process
for setting the version of erlang used with rabbitmq the new variable
`rabbitmq_erlang_version_spec` has been added. This option has a default
of "null" and is set by distro specific variables when applicable.

Erlang version support matrix: https://www.rabbitmq.com/which-erlang.html

Change-Id: Iced12d4533eec068bd11d8bd235d81308ef40427
(cherry picked from commit ce90c91857de4a840e5db655a3a42b5de0482ede)
Signed-off-by: Kevin Carter <kevin.carter@rackspace.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 20:51:01.000000000', 'files': ['tools/cleanup-host'], 'message': 'Avoid removing kolla-cli directories on destroy

When running the kolla-ansible destroy playbook most of the files
under /etc/kolla are cleaned up.  This change will cause the
clean-up to skip the kolla-cli related directories.  When running
the deployment code in a container or a separate VM this is not
an issue, but when doing an all-in-one or running the deployment
process from one of the systems being deployed onto it would have
previously destroyed the kolla-cli inventory and any generated
certificates used for TLS.

Change-Id: Icd62e177964b8fb31052131785c6d7b138975a28
'}]
commit_message:
Avoid removing kolla-cli directories on destroy

When running the kolla-ansible destroy playbook most of the files
under /etc/kolla are cleaned up.  This change will cause the
clean-up to skip the kolla-cli related directories.  When running
the deployment code in a container or a separate VM this is not
an issue, but when doing an all-in-one or running the deployment
process from one of the systems being deployed onto it would have
previously destroyed the kolla-cli inventory and any generated
certificates used for TLS.

Change-Id: Icd62e177964b8fb31052131785c6d7b138975a28

commit_message:
Django 2.0 support

Replace django.core.urlresolves with django.urls

(In Django 2.0) The django.core.urlresolvers module is removed
in favor of its new location, django.urls.
It was deprecated in Django 1.10:
https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/2.0/releases/1.10/#id3

Add py35dj20 job to test Django 2.0 integration.

Change-Id: I4664b039fbd1b66587ee90f241a27f8d0d05b8ec

commit_message:
Add granular policy rules for placement allocations

This adds the granular policy rules for the placement
allocation related APIs (except for allocation candidates).
By default the rules are backward compatible and use the
system scope type which is not enforced by default.

Part of blueprint granular-placement-policy

Change-Id: I7abb08d79190017b5d2af4ed6e1b0b124b378339

subject: Improve speed of loading Pools from DB
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 6469, 'name': 'Carlos Gonçalves', 'display_name': 'Carlos Goncalves', 'email': 'cgoncalves@redhat.com', 'username': 'cgoncalves'}, {'_account_id': 9008, 'name': 'VMware NSX CI', 'username': 'vmwareminesweeper', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 11628, 'name': 'Michael Johnson', 'email': 'johnsomor@gmail.com', 'username': 'johnsom'}, {'_account_id': 12860, 'name': 'Dongcan Ye', 'email': 'yedongcan@yeah.net', 'username': 'yedongcan'}, {'_account_id': 12907, 'name': 'Jan Zerebecki', 'email': 'jan.openstack@zerebecki.de', 'username': 'jzerebecki'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-06-04 14:03:02.000000000', 'files': ['neutron_lbaas/services/loadbalancer/plugin.py', 'neutron_lbaas/db/loadbalancer/loadbalancer_dbv2.py', 'neutron_lbaas/db/loadbalancer/models.py'], 'message': 'Improve speed of loading Pools from DB

This removes from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from get_pools, instead more directly transforming
from the SQLAlchemy model to the required api dictionary format. Thus
this entierly skips loading a few relations that walking the
intermediary object model triggered without the target output needing
them.

Use eager loading where the api dictionary representation is needed, as
the relations needed for it are always the same.

In a test with a bit more than 100 LBs with Pools this improved the
speed of a cli call of lbaas-pool-list.

Story: 2001962
Change-Id: I280de9b03464376b9288e647ae8ddacc262b5584
'}]
commit_message:
Improve speed of loading Pools from DB

This removes from_sqlalchemy_model and the related object intermediary
representation from get_pools, instead more directly transforming
from the SQLAlchemy model to the required api dictionary format. Thus
this entierly skips loading a few relations that walking the
intermediary object model triggered without the target output needing
them.

Use eager loading where the api dictionary representation is needed, as
the relations needed for it are always the same.

In a test with a bit more than 100 LBs with Pools this improved the
speed of a cli call of lbaas-pool-list.

Story: 2001962
Change-Id: I280de9b03464376b9288e647ae8ddacc262b5584

commit_message:
Fix installLogstash.yml

The 30-elasticsearch-output.conf.j2 were renamed to
99-elasticsearch-output.conf.j2 in the templates directory but not in the
task "Drop Logstash conf for beats output" in installLogstash.yml playbook.

In addition to that, templates/extras file were created and also a task to create
/opt/logstash/patterns were added in the playbook.

Change-Id: I5ddd2694bf03726bf76ba30d34515b4b02f64234

subject: Update default Ironic API version to 1.38
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-06-08 10:16:01.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/story-2002166-371315335fd8e62d.yaml', 'ironic_inspector/common/ironic.py'], 'message': 'Update default Ironic API version to 1.38

Currently the default API version used when creating ironic client
objects is 1.19, which was from the Newton (6.1.0) release. While it is
possible to create a client object with a more recent version within
plugins, introspection rules always use the default. This prevents
access to and updating of fields added in versions after 1.19.

This change updates the default ironic API version to 1.38, which was
the version at the time of the most recent Queens series release
(10.1.0).

Change-Id: I395f18612e20d4f7d71e503391ca2381bad68192
Story: 2002166
Task: 20017
'}]
commit_message:
Update default Ironic API version to 1.38

Currently the default API version used when creating ironic client
objects is 1.19, which was from the Newton (6.1.0) release. While it is
possible to create a client object with a more recent version within
plugins, introspection rules always use the default. This prevents
access to and updating of fields added in versions after 1.19.

This change updates the default ironic API version to 1.38, which was
the version at the time of the most recent Queens series release
(10.1.0).

Change-Id: I395f18612e20d4f7d71e503391ca2381bad68192
Story: 2002166
Task: 20017

commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I2db130183c0a657b281e0990593fb86be6bef017
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-06-08 05:40:14.000000000', 'files': ['ironic_python_agent/shell/write_image.sh'], 'message': 'Fix for fatal error when GPT was used and only MBR was cleaned

You can generate this error if after having provisioned a node
using GPT partitioning, you clean its MBR using say
dd if=/dev/zero bs=1024 count=1 of=/dev/sda
and then cleanup all Ironic/Bifrost informations to get it
reprovisioned.
In this case sgdisk -Z returns an error and last_error field
in Ironic contains:
Error writing image to device: Writing image to device
        /dev/sda failed with exit code 2
Caution: invalid main GPT header, but valid backup;
        regenerating main header\nfrom backup!\n
        \nInvalid partition data!\

Change-Id: Ib617737fff5e40cb376edda0232e0726d9c71231
(cherry picked from commit 5fcf3f066ccdbcc081ae35ab25f1c18737b94778)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix for fatal error when GPT was used and only MBR was cleaned

You can generate this error if after having provisioned a node
using GPT partitioning, you clean its MBR using say
dd if=/dev/zero bs=1024 count=1 of=/dev/sda
and then cleanup all Ironic/Bifrost informations to get it
reprovisioned.
In this case sgdisk -Z returns an error and last_error field
in Ironic contains:
Error writing image to device: Writing image to device
        /dev/sda failed with exit code 2
Caution: invalid main GPT header, but valid backup;
        regenerating main header\nfrom backup!\n
        \nInvalid partition data!\

Change-Id: Ib617737fff5e40cb376edda0232e0726d9c71231
(cherry picked from commit 5fcf3f066ccdbcc081ae35ab25f1c18737b94778)

revisions:

Introduces foundational logic needed for multi-policy support
to rbac_rule_validation module. Patrole now offers support for
multiple policies. The ``rules`` argument has been added to the
``rbac_rule_validation.action`` decorator, which takes a list of
policy names which Patrole will use to determine the expected test
result. This allows Patrole to more accurately determine
whether RBAC is configured correctly, since some API endpoints
enforce multiple policies.

The new ``rules`` argument is implemented for
test_unlock_server_override test which corresponds to [0]
which enforces:

    rules=["os_compute_api:os-lock-server:unlock:unlock",
           "os_compute_api:os-lock-server:unlock:unlock_override"]

which is set for this test.

The ``rule`` argument in the ``rbac_rule_validation.action``
decorator has been deprecated in favor of ``rules``.

The following will be carried out in additional follow up patches:

  * Renaming rule to rules
  * Adding multi-policy support carefully for selected APIs
    to be tracked via an etherpad
  * Updating Patrole documentation with multi-policy support
    details

[0] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/0ab78890c155f0b6ffc7c4148b26642f47aa7070/nova/api/openstack/compute/lock_server.py#L42

Partially Implements: bp rbac-testing-multiple-policies
Change-Id: Iec651aff1c1ef6acda19bcad2f57720f1dd3f8a0
'}]
commit_message:
Update rbac_rule_validation for multi-policy support

Introduces foundational logic needed for multi-policy support
to rbac_rule_validation module. Patrole now offers support for
multiple policies. The ``rules`` argument has been added to the
``rbac_rule_validation.action`` decorator, which takes a list of
policy names which Patrole will use to determine the expected test
result. This allows Patrole to more accurately determine
whether RBAC is configured correctly, since some API endpoints
enforce multiple policies.

The new ``rules`` argument is implemented for
test_unlock_server_override test which corresponds to [0]
which enforces:

    rules=["os_compute_api:os-lock-server:unlock:unlock",
           "os_compute_api:os-lock-server:unlock:unlock_override"]

which is set for this test.

The ``rule`` argument in the ``rbac_rule_validation.action``
decorator has been deprecated in favor of ``rules``.

The following will be carried out in additional follow up patches:

  * Renaming rule to rules
  * Adding multi-policy support carefully for selected APIs
    to be tracked via an etherpad
  * Updating Patrole documentation with multi-policy support
    details

[0] https://github.com/openstack/nova/blob/0ab78890c155f0b6ffc7c4148b26642f47aa7070/nova/api/openstack/compute/lock_server.py#L42

Partially Implements: bp rbac-testing-multiple-policies
Change-Id: Iec651aff1c1ef6acda19bcad2f57720f1dd3f8a0

breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2018-06-05 15:30:23.000000000', 'files': ['deployed-server/scripts/get-occ-config.sh'], 'message': 'Fix fail_if_empty invocation with pipes

* Since $@ parameter may have pipe '|' it should be processed correctly.
  Currenly the part before pipe is assigned as $@ so bash runs pipe with
  commands after it after execution of function. However, we want to assign
  command with pipe to $@ thus "" around command with pipe are required.
* replace $() with eval as $() doesn't work correctly with pipe as it tries to
  escape pipe so output variable contains wrong data.
* This patch adds tonumber to first invocation

Change-Id: I958e14c0a4ea4b5782d2c74dc895471b0f70b875
'}]
commit_message:
Fix fail_if_empty invocation with pipes

* Since $@ parameter may have pipe '|' it should be processed correctly.
  Currenly the part before pipe is assigned as $@ so bash runs pipe with
  commands after it after execution of function. However, we want to assign
  command with pipe to $@ thus "" around command with pipe are required.
* replace $() with eval as $() doesn't work correctly with pipe as it tries to
  escape pipe so output variable contains wrong data.
* This patch adds tonumber to first invocation

Change-Id: I958e14c0a4ea4b5782d2c74dc895471b0f70b875

commit_message:
Update repo_build role SHA for custom PyPi indexes fix

Some old Python2 pip sources still use setup.py, so when you provide
your own index sources via repo_build_pip_default_index the 'Download
requirement pip sources' task might fail while trying to reach a
default external PyPI index URL.

This patch brings in the updated role SHA which includes
the required fix for this to work.

Depends-On: Ib7d2a9aee9b13f38b73136f22f0b51e766c8dd10
Change-Id: I15d61595a8573437f9af51953539376e8030df2b
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Don't install kolla by default

The vast majority of undercloud installs will be consuming already
built images, so they don't need kolla to be installed.

This changes the default so that openstack-kolla won't be installed
unless the user enables that with enable_container_images_build.

Change-Id: I932f0f2048275942e29b589b337561473d5cb0b8

The network create API will create the network in docker and
return immediately, so there is no need to perform a aysnc (202)
processing which has overhead on spawning a new thread for
each request.

This patch changes this API to a sync API. As a result, the response
code of create_network switches from 202 to 200. The RPC call changes
from 'cast' to 'call'. The compute manager will process the request

Change-Id: Ie1ec42e80f816e456372fb29db6ddaaa8a47c669
"}]
commit_message:
Change create_network from async to sync

The network create API will create the network in docker and
return immediately, so there is no need to perform a aysnc (202)
processing which has overhead on spawning a new thread for
each request.

This patch changes this API to a sync API. As a result, the response
code of create_network switches from 202 to 200. The RPC call changes
from 'cast' to 'call'. The compute manager will process the request
in main thread instead of spawning a new thread.

Change-Id: Ie1ec42e80f816e456372fb29db6ddaaa8a47c669

commit_message:
Add 'host' parameter on image delete

The image delete API is targeted for deleting image artifact
(i.e. the downloaded tarball) from specific host.
In before, a random host is chosen which is odd. In this patch,
we let users to specify a host on deleting the image.

Change-Id: Ie2edde77b7444e1025559b1aa1d67c9c8782620f
Partial-Implements: blueprint rework-image-api

commit_message:
Add 'host' parameter on image create

The image create API is for pulling image into specific host.
In before, a random host is chosen which is odd. In this patch,
we let users to specify a host on pulling the image.

Change-Id: Ic576a3532f78debc1db4377e22af8fcab10b260e
Partial-Implements: blueprint rework-image-api

commit_message:
Raise the right exception if network exists

This patch attempts to address the outstanding comments in
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/564800/17 .

If users create a network with an already exists neutron network,
Zun will raise an 'ContainerAlreadyExists' exception which is
confusing. This patch changes it to raise 'NetworkAlreadyExists'
instead. In addition, this patch also adds several unit test cases
for create_network.

Change-Id: I68e32143e0e750ab250a34ef0228a4778791e7a3

commit_message:
Improve error message in fullstack test

_assert_ping_during_agents_restart is used in tests of L2 and L3
agents. However, when it raises an exception due to a timeout, the
associated message assumes the agent under test is L2. This patch
fixes that

 * The TokenAuthMiddleware code (with deprecation warning) has been

Change-Id: I35064a440ef718f50c7e644e8b2d56a99c3ec74f

commit_message:
Remove pastedeploy

This patchset removes the lingering code that supported paste.deploy
that is obsolted by the loader wrapped around keystone's use of Flask.

 * The keystone-paste.ini file has been removed.

 * All options have been removed (without deprecation) as they are no
   longer referenced.

 * The TokenAuthMiddleware code (with deprecation warning) has been
   removed as it was only provided to ensure compatibility with paste.ini
   files that were not updated (ensuring not breaking a deployer that
   did not update paste.ini file to remove it from the pipeline).

 * Paste deploy entrypoints have been removed.

Change-Id: I35064a440ef718f50c7e644e8b2d56a99c3ec74f

commit_message:
Remove the rest of v2.0 legacy

This patch removes the rest of the v2.0 specific code which was being
maintained exclusively due to a copy-paste issue with the deprecation
warning on the EC2 controller(s). With sign off from TC members
we have removed all of the bits except those exclusively tied to
the paste.deploy removal. All paste.deploy specific changes will
be removed in a future patch.

With the conversion to Flask, none of the v2.0 legacy controllers
left were wired up to routes that could be accessed.

Change-Id: I959dac0d0dd2e667982383e1e3d52ab28c4c1e2e

commit_message:
Empty groupname will be 'DEFAULT' by default

By default, if the groupname is None, set it to 'DEFAULT'.
Seems like several libraries are exporting such groups, and it causes
sorting the 'by_section.items()' list to fail.

Closes-Bug: #1705245

Change-Id: I2001dc4894ff1e24c0eaed9ba71e3c5fba02ae36
(cherry picked from commit d7931f25738a435574cd2d7740c650c78d71fdc2)
(cherry picked from commit 3f9f8d935003b2d35dbc5a915aa23e3bbf341f6e)

subject: fix tox python3 overrides
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 19:27:46.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ibb94564d92ef729509d9891500730d7489406a83
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: Ibb94564d92ef729509d9891500730d7489406a83
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

[{'number': 5, 'created': '2018-06-08 10:23:12.000000000', 'files': ['ansible-role-requirements.yml'], 'message': "Update repo_build role SHA for custom PyPi indexes fix

Some old Python2 pip sources still use setup.py, so when you provide
your own index sources via repo_build_pip_default_index the 'Download
requirement pip sources' task might fail while trying to reach a
default external PyPI index URL.

This patch brings in the updated role SHA which includes

commit_message:
Update repo_build role SHA for custom PyPi indexes fix

Some old Python2 pip sources still use setup.py, so when you provide
your own index sources via repo_build_pip_default_index the 'Download
requirement pip sources' task might fail while trying to reach a
default external PyPI index URL.

This patch brings in the updated role SHA which includes
the required fix for this to work.

Depends-On: Ib7d2a9aee9b13f38b73136f22f0b51e766c8dd10
Change-Id: I15d61595a8573437f9af51953539376e8030df2b
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Update os_tempest role SHA pin for cmd2 pin

In order to build from a git source, rather than from pypi,
the os_tempest role needs to include an appropriate pin in
its requirements.

This patch brings in the updated role SHA which includes
the required pin for cmd2.

Depends-On: Id5b9274ce39dec3d5ee295d7ef941bf42ca7cbd2
Change-Id: Id3129fc10f0e0c87ebe9a9257a17dc9ef06dbe11
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Check node processes earlier

When creating a cluster, validate node processes as early as we can.

(The config-recommending step may have some impact on validity, so we
must leave that as the first call.)

Note that there has been a desire mentioned to move the node process
validation to occur during cluster template creation. Unfortunately the
amount of refactoring needed makes the task too daunting to be
completed now.

Change-Id: Ib5c91e062b32a83268d178417cbc5120d4c57934

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-04 19:31:45.000000000', 'files': ['sahara/api/v2/clusters.py', 'sahara/service/validations/clusters.py', 'sahara/service/validations/clusters_schema.py', 'sahara/tests/unit/service/api/v2/test_clusters.py', 'sahara/service/api/v2/clusters.py', 'releasenotes/notes/consolidate-cluster-creation-apiv2-5d5aceeb2e97c702.yaml'], 'message': '[APIv2]Consolidate cluster creation endpoints

Creation of a single cluster and creation of multiple clusters will now

original single-cluster endpoint will accept a `count` parameter in the
request and the multiple-cluster endpoint has been removed.

We can make this kind of change because APIv2 is still experimental.

Also, when creating multiple clusters, the response will now contain
all details about the clusters; previously, the response simply gave
cluster IDs.

Change-Id: I90faf4956a8ea4b4ae31a29382732771fdfddecb
Story: 2002099
Task: 19777
'}]
commit_message:
[APIv2]Consolidate cluster creation endpoints

Creation of a single cluster and creation of multiple clusters will now
share an API endpoint (in the APIv2 case). More specifically, the
original single-cluster endpoint will accept a `count` parameter in the
request and the multiple-cluster endpoint has been removed.

We can make this kind of change because APIv2 is still experimental.

Also, when creating multiple clusters, the response will now contain
all details about the clusters; previously, the response simply gave
cluster IDs.

Change-Id: I90faf4956a8ea4b4ae31a29382732771fdfddecb
Story: 2002099
Task: 19777

revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2018-06-06 07:24:12.000000000', 'files': ['kuryr_kubernetes/controller/handlers/lbaas.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/tests/unit/controller/drivers/test_lbaasv2.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/lbaasv2.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/controller/drivers/base.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/objects/lbaas.py', 'kuryr_kubernetes/tests/unit/controller/handlers/test_lbaas.py'], 'message': "Service: Decoupling and improvements of LBaaS driver

A Kuryr controller handler associates itself with specific Kubernetes object
kind (e.g: endpoint) and it's responsible for handling the events of this
object.
The Kuryr controller handlers call one or more Kuryr controller drivers to
manage specific aspects of the Kubernetes resource in the OpenStack domain.
This patch makes K8S-Endpoint handler and LBaaS driver decoupled, and also
updates LBaaS driver to be more generic (e.g: support create a pool that
attached to loadbalancer).

After having this change the LBaaS driver could be extended to
support L7 load balancing, means it could be used as the Ingress driver.

Closes-Bug: 1770934

Change-Id: Ifcda04cc0116bf42e79aa4f855dc9df73671b4d9
"}]
commit_message:
Service: Decoupling and improvements of LBaaS driver

A Kuryr controller handler associates itself with specific Kubernetes object
kind (e.g: endpoint) and it's responsible for handling the events of this
object.
The Kuryr controller handlers call one or more Kuryr controller drivers to
manage specific aspects of the Kubernetes resource in the OpenStack domain.
This patch makes K8S-Endpoint handler and LBaaS driver decoupled, and also
updates LBaaS driver to be more generic (e.g: support create a pool that
attached to loadbalancer).

After having this change the LBaaS driver could be extended to
support L7 load balancing, means it could be used as the Ingress driver.

Closes-Bug: 1770934

Change-Id: Ifcda04cc0116bf42e79aa4f855dc9df73671b4d9

commit_message:
Make owners a 'proper' openstack_election command

This change moves the argument parsing for owners.py into it's own
module.  We preserve the exiting shell interface.  This is the first
step to allowing refactors between owners.py and the other
openstack_election modules.

The installation docs as commented in owners.py were moved and slight
updated

Change-Id: Idf0df6a5b319da2dc1ec4334d1fa0776f3d56612

commit_message:
Fix PEP8 errors

Mostly these should be obvious whitespace only changes.  The change to
owners.py (at approximately line 350 is mod complex as it switches from
an explicit if/elif/else construct to using the .get() method on a
dictionary

Change-Id: I34a56f48a92bf838299dd1026ad43423031012aa

subject: Reduce sphinx warnings.
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-05-15 05:21:32.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/_exts/ptl_archive.jinja', 'doc/source/_exts/tc_archive.jinja', 'doc/source/conf.py', 'doc/source/_exts/candidates.py'], 'message': "Reduce sphinx warnings.

This does several things to reduce the number of warnings generated in a
docs build.

. Only generate the {ptl,tc}.rst for the type of election we're running
. use a for loop to match the undreline with the section title
. Ensure that we use anonymous hyperlinks ``__ vs ``_
. tell sphinx to ignore the generated announcement as they're not linked

There are still 4 left which look to me like actual bugs in
sphinux/docutils rather than our RST.

Change-Id: I64a12d1c49c5b71a6849ad1724ac4ae09daeb85a
"}]
commit_message:
Reduce sphinx warnings.

This does several things to reduce the number of warnings generated in a
docs build.

. Only generate the {ptl,tc}.rst for the type of election we're running
. use a for loop to match the undreline with the section title
. Ensure that we use anonymous hyperlinks ``__ vs ``_
. tell sphinx to ignore the generated announcement as they're not linked

There are still 4 left which look to me like actual bugs in
sphinux/docutils rather than our RST.

Change-Id: I64a12d1c49c5b71a6849ad1724ac4ae09daeb85a

commit_message:
Hide the candidate list if building the docs outside an election

When we close an election and add the results database we'll rebuild
(and publish) the docs  Take that opportunity to remove auto-magically
remove the candidates list from the index page

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 21:11:10.000000000', 'files': ['cloudkitty/storage/hybrid/backends/gnocchi.py'], 'message': "remove use of unicode type for python 2/3 compatibility

There is no 'unicode' type under python 3. Instead of using a tuple
with str and unicode to check the type of the metric, use

Change-Id: Ie380ec1a982212b33ec40f651ebce159d4fac79e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
"}]
commit_message:
remove use of unicode type for python 2/3 compatibility

There is no 'unicode' type under python 3. Instead of using a tuple
with str and unicode to check the type of the metric, use
six.text_type, which is set to the correct type under each version of
python.

Change-Id: Ie380ec1a982212b33ec40f651ebce159d4fac79e
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Update os_tempest role SHA pin for cmd2 pin

In order to build from a git source, rather than from pypi,
the os_tempest role needs to include an appropriate pin in
its requirements.

This patch brings in the updated role SHA which includes
the required pin for cmd2.

Depends-On: Id5b9274ce39dec3d5ee295d7ef941bf42ca7cbd2
Change-Id: Id3129fc10f0e0c87ebe9a9257a17dc9ef06dbe11
Signed-off-by: Maksim Malchuk <maksim.malchuk@gmail.com>

subject: Add in ability to load DEBUG middleware
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 16:35:57.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/conf/__init__.py', 'keystone/server/flask/core.py', 'keystone/conf/wsgi.py'], 'message': 'Add in ability to load DEBUG middleware

This change adds a new config group ``[wsgi]`` with the ability
to load in the oslo.middleware Debug middleware. The DEBUG middleware
is placed as the first middleware in the chain printing out raw
request/response data closest to the edge of the applciation.

The new option is ``debug_middleware`` and is boolean. It defaults
to "False". This option should never be set in production as it
can and will leak sensitive information via the printed data.

Change-Id: I013e38f3578e6ea8e5bad3123fe47bf93b840b43
'}]
commit_message:
Add in ability to load DEBUG middleware

This change adds a new config group ``[wsgi]`` with the ability
to load in the oslo.middleware Debug middleware. The DEBUG middleware
is placed as the first middleware in the chain printing out raw
request/response data closest to the edge of the applciation.

The new option is ``debug_middleware`` and is boolean. It defaults
to "False". This option should never be set in production as it
can and will leak sensitive information via the printed data.

Change-Id: I013e38f3578e6ea8e5bad3123fe47bf93b840b43

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 9414, 'name': 'zhongshengping', 'email': 'chdzsp@163.com', 'username': 'ZhongShengping'}, {'_account_id': 13252, 'name': 'Dr. Jens Harbott', 'display_name': 'Jens Harbott (frickler)', 'email': 'frickler@offenerstapel.de', 'username': 'jrosenboom'}, {'_account_id': 22348, 'name': 'Zuul', 'username': 'zuul', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 22623, 'name': 'Erik Olof Gunnar Andersson', 'email': 'eandersson@blizzard.com', 'username': 'eoandersson'}, {'_account_id': 27153, 'name': 'Nguyen Hai', 'email': 'nguyentrihai93@gmail.com', 'username': 'nguyentrihai'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-07 16:45:03.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If352b0ca1de2cda56089ebe1c7db04feb5ba983b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: If352b0ca1de2cda56089ebe1c7db04feb5ba983b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

commit_message:
Improves SSL ciphers in HAProxy config

Changes SSL cipher string to explicitly establish ciphers to use.
Used the following guide as reference:
https://hynek.me/articles/hardening-your-web-servers-ssl-ciphers/

Change-Id: Id8cfbf3145ebb597bdfc8fc8d8265b960748ad4d
Closes-Bug: #1732540

subject: Move database creation into role (gnocchi)
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-01 14:09:32.000000000', 'files': ['playbooks/os-gnocchi-install.yml'], 'message': 'Move database creation into role (gnocchi)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: Ia183b0ec21863b6c8e3cce1aa7ce6d9fc55f1e04
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571735
'}]
commit_message:
Move database creation into role (gnocchi)

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the group_vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

Change-Id: Ia183b0ec21863b6c8e3cce1aa7ce6d9fc55f1e04
Depends-On: https://review.openstack.org/571735

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 20:07:21.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'message': 'fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I59ac21cb0d34f0b6767c736d0419eb6b874efca1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>
'}]
commit_message:
fix tox python3 overrides

We want to default to running all tox environments under python 3, so
set the basepython value in each environment.

We do not want to specify a minor version number, because we do not
want to have to update the file every time we upgrade python.

We do not want to set the override once in testenv, because that
breaks the more specific versions used in default environments like
py35 and py36.

Change-Id: I59ac21cb0d34f0b6767c736d0419eb6b874efca1
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug@doughellmann.com>

subject: Update to use oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notify
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-06-04 18:26:07.000000000', 'files': ['tests/inventory', 'doc/source/index.rst', 'releasenotes/notes/oslo-messaging-separate-backends-60f81dae397b1c96.yaml', 'tests/os_aodh-overrides.yml', 'examples/playbook.yml', 'README.rst', 'defaults/main.yml', 'templates/aodh.conf.j2', 'tests/test-install-aodh.yml'], 'message': 'Update to use oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the aodh service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation (add for notifications)
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory
* Update tests
* Add release note
* Update README and example

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5

Change-Id: I356e7256f5e8090f35dce8a02fd633638fd659fa
'}]
commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and
Notify transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters
replace the rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging
transport_url for the service. The association of the messaging
backend server to the oslo.messaging services will then be
transparent to the aodh service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation (add for notifications)
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory
* Update tests
* Add release note
* Update README and example

Depends-On: If4326a6848d2d32af284fdbb94798eb0b03734d5
Depends-On: I2b09145b60116c029fc85477399c24f94974b61d
Change-Id: I356e7256f5e8090f35dce8a02fd633638fd659fa

commit_message:

There is no record for why we implement the database creation outside
of the role in the playbook, when we could do it inside the role.

Implementing it inside the role allows us to reduce the quantity of
group_vars duplicated from the role, and allows us to better document
the required variables in the role. The delegation can still be done
as it is done in the playbook too.

In this patch we remove the test-vars which were duplicated from the
role, and remove the DB setup tasks as they are no longer required.

commit_message:
Update to use oslo.messaging services for RPC and Notify

This introduces oslo.messaging variables that define the RPC and Notify
transports for the OpenStack services. These parameters replace the
rabbitmq values and are used to generate the messaging transport_url for
the service. The association of the messaging backend server to the
oslo.messaging service will be transparent to the designate service.

This patch:
* Add oslo.messaging variables for RPC and Notify to defaults
* Update transport_url generation (add for notification)
* Add oslo.messaging to tests inventory
* Update tests
* Add releaes note
* Update README and example playbook

Change-Id: I620a13e1ea3c24c8bd31c02206613d37d769dd30

subject: Updated RBac test cases for update/delete volume image metadata
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-04 16:18:50.000000000', 'files': ['patrole_tempest_plugin/tests/api/volume/test_volume_metadata_rbac.py'], 'message': "Updated RBac test cases for update/delete volume image metadata

Add logic to check for 'volume_image_metadata' attribute in the response as the
server will still respond with 200 if the user does not have the permission to
perform the action. The difference will be the present or not present of the
'volume_image_metadata' attribute.

Change-Id: I489a89c67e39108f4f5ceb86283b4c9a30b58ff5
"}]
commit_message:
Updated RBac test cases for update/delete volume image metadata

Add logic to check for 'volume_image_metadata' attribute in the response as the
server will still respond with 200 if the user does not have the permission to
perform the action. The difference will be the present or not present of the
'volume_image_metadata' attribute.

Change-Id: I489a89c67e39108f4f5ceb86283b4c9a30b58ff5

commit_message:
Add upgrade jobs for CentOS 7

This adds an upgrade job for CentOS 7, we purposely do not add a
non-voting one because we can simply add voting: false in the
project stanza which is the recommended way of doing things as
per infra.

Change-Id: I804ecab571f8e70fc01d86741246dd8cbafb15fb

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2018-06-05 01:08:01.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/mech_driver.py', 'neutron/plugins/ml2/rpc.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/plugins/ml2/drivers/l2pop/test_mech_driver.py'], 'message': "Don't skip DVR port while neutron-openvswitch-agent is restared.

neutron-openvswitch-agent will refresh flows when it's restarted.
But the port's binding status is not changed, update_port_postcommit
will be skipped at function '_update_individual_port_db_status' in
'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', l2pop don't handle DVR ports, the
fdb entries about DVR port will not be added.

So, we can't skip DVR port at notify_l2pop_port_wiring when agent
is restared.

Closes-Bug: #1773286
Change-Id: I54e3db4822830a0c83daf7b5150575f8d6e2497b
"}]
commit_message:
Don't skip DVR port while neutron-openvswitch-agent is restared.

neutron-openvswitch-agent will refresh flows when it's restarted.
But the port's binding status is not changed, update_port_postcommit
will be skipped at function '_update_individual_port_db_status' in
'neutron/plugins/ml2/plugin.py', l2pop don't handle DVR ports, the
fdb entries about DVR port will not be added.

So, we can't skip DVR port at notify_l2pop_port_wiring when agent
is restared.

Closes-Bug: #1773286
Change-Id: I54e3db4822830a0c83daf7b5150575f8d6e2497b

After tox 2.5.0 usage on OpenStack infrastructure for build jobs,

.../tox.ini".

commit_message:
Specify placeholder testenv command for tox>=2.5

After tox 2.5.0 usage on OpenStack infrastructure for build jobs,
current tox.ini fails with the following error message:

"ERROR: Commands not specified. Please update relevant section of
.../tox.ini".

This commit proposes a placeholder commands line in [testenv]
not to occur the build job failure for tox>=2.5.

Change-Id: I004dbef8da369c5d6dc8f90880738636b8ec5cfd

[{'number': 14, 'created': '2018-05-21 06:39:42.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/placement/objects/resource_provider.py', 'nova/tests/functional/api/openstack/placement/db/test_allocation_candidates.py'], 'message': 'Return nested providers in get_by_request

This patch start to return nested providers in get_by_requests().
However, this is not complete because

1) It leaves a bug that placement returns a "branch" without requested
   traits in a "tree", one of whose "branch" has requested traits.
   This is reported in bug#1771707.
2) Not all the resource providers in a tree are returned
   in provider_summaries. This is done later under the
   blueprint: placement-return-all-resources.
3) It doesn't support cases where there are sharing providers in the
   system.

These are well described in test cases and will be addressed in
following patches.

Blueprint: nested-resource-providers-allocation-candidates
Change-Id: Ib119a7e14d83a3562519b4653fb0813f2d31af21
Related-Bug: #1771707
'}]
commit_message:
Return nested providers in get_by_request

This patch start to return nested providers in get_by_requests().
However, this is not complete because

1) It leaves a bug that placement returns a "branch" without requested
   traits in a "tree", one of whose "branch" has requested traits.
   This is reported in bug#1771707.
2) Not all the resource providers in a tree are returned
   in provider_summaries. This is done later under the
   blueprint: placement-return-all-resources.
3) It doesn't support cases where there are sharing providers in the
   system.

These are well described in test cases and will be addressed in
following patches.

Blueprint: nested-resource-providers-allocation-candidates
Change-Id: Ib119a7e14d83a3562519b4653fb0813f2d31af21
Related-Bug: #1771707

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-05-04 17:39:28.000000000', 'files': ['tripleoclient/workflows/deployment.py'], 'message': "Show Heat events by default

Commit I105fb6b37769411178cff5f2c8ea0496f2a9cd2e changed the default
behavior such that Heat events aren't shown by default during a
deployment. This is a regression in usability. This patch restores the
previous behavior such that the Heat stack events are shown even when
--verbose is not passed.

Change-Id: If36c362aaef069da5a41ce74aede9aa2ba993463
"}]
commit_message:
Show Heat events by default

Commit I105fb6b37769411178cff5f2c8ea0496f2a9cd2e changed the default
behavior such that Heat events aren't shown by default during a
deployment. This is a regression in usability. This patch restores the
previous behavior such that the Heat stack events are shown even when
--verbose is not passed.

Change-Id: If36c362aaef069da5a41ce74aede9aa2ba993463

commit_message:
db: Add network_requests to instance_extra

Add a deferred-load column to the instance_extras table, which can be
used to store a serialized representation of the 'NetworkRequestList'
object for use later.

The object-related parts of this are included in a separate patch.

Part of blueprint numa-aware-vswitches

Change-Id: I1105a5c4e8f1e6974006943a6d2a379f31d57d6d

In some cases, we may not want to always assume the ctlplane as the

commit_message:
Add --overcloud-ssh-network

In some cases, we may not want to always assume the ctlplane as the
network to use for both ssh access to the overcloud nodes, and for
generating the ansible inventory. This patches adds a new cli argument,
--overcloud-ssh-network that can be used to set the network name to be
used. Defaults to ctlplane.

Depends-On: I1e3f9a5142bff5e4f77e5e40df164089d9144652
Change-Id: I767984623c7d2402b10bae3d30b695783166f6bf

commit_message:
Create config-download-latest symlink

Each time the config-download workflow is run, create a symlink at
/var/lib/mistral/config-download-latest that will point to the latest
execution uuid under /var/lib/mistral. This will make it easier for
users to quickly find the latest config-download working directory.

Change-Id: I9375f343a70653203cb984065e14fe616a35c5cc

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2018-06-06 01:12:55.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/placement/objects/resource_provider.py'], 'message': "Ensure resource class cache when listing usages

In rare circumstances it is possible to list usages in a new placement
process that has not yet instantiated the _RC_CACHE but for which
there are inventories and allocations in the database (added by
other processes running against the same db). Before this change
that would cause a 500 error (AttributeError) when the Usage objects
in the UsageList were instantiated.

The fix is to added _ensure_rc_cache to the two list methods. The
addition is done there rather than in the _from_db_object as the
latter would cause a lot of redundant checks.

While we could probably devise a test for this, it's perhaps good
enough to evaluate the change by inspection. If not, suggestions
welcome.

Change-Id: I00f7dee26f031366dbc0d3d6a03abe89afeb85fd
Closes-Bug: #1775308
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure resource class cache when listing usages

In rare circumstances it is possible to list usages in a new placement
process that has not yet instantiated the _RC_CACHE but for which
there are inventories and allocations in the database (added by
other processes running against the same db). Before this change
that would cause a 500 error (AttributeError) when the Usage objects
in the UsageList were instantiated.

The fix is to added _ensure_rc_cache to the two list methods. The
addition is done there rather than in the _from_db_object as the
latter would cause a lot of redundant checks.

While we could probably devise a test for this, it's perhaps good
enough to evaluate the change by inspection. If not, suggestions
welcome.

Change-Id: I00f7dee26f031366dbc0d3d6a03abe89afeb85fd
Closes-Bug: #1775308
